loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Abelie

texts.en:
Abelie is 43 years old and single with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell.

Abelie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Abelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell

loans.name: Pho's Group

texts.en: Pho, 45, and the mother of four children, lives in Battambang province..To earn a living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved this business for years and earns about 42,800 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Pho with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Chanthol is 59 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. She earns income to support her family by growing rice and she also grows rubber to earn more income. This is the fourth loan for Chanthol with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee and buy school materials for her children. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee and buy school materials for her children.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Nenita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Felina is requesting her twenty ninth loan from NWTF for 28,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchse more fish to sell

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Ra is a 35-year-old mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province. Ra grows rice and styles hair to earn additional income. She has been involved this business for many years and earns about 34,400 KHR per day. For Ra, this is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of three members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy make-up materials to support her salon. She hopes that she can increase her income to improve her living standard..

loans.use: To buy make-up materials to support her salon.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and married with six children, four in school. Janet works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell .

Janet has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Moeun is 38 years old and a mother of four children. She grows rice and lotus as her main source of income. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline to support her lotus growing. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to support her lotus growing.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Moyheang's Group

texts.en: Moyheang, 43, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two school children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for years and earns about 45,600 KHR per day. She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven estudiante de Bioanalisis, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Maribel tengo 23 años. Nací en moca y crecí en la vega, soy soltera, vivo con mi madre y dos hermanas, mi padre falleció y mi madre es ama de casa.
Estudio Bioanalisis en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao UCATECI, elegí esta carrera porque me gusta, ya que nos ayuda a ser más humanos y ayudar a personas realmente necesitadas. Tengo estudiando esta carrera 2 años y dos cuatrimestres. He cursado 50 materias y la que más me ha gustado es parasitología II.
Este préstamo es necesario para poder terminar mis estudios ya que sin él no podre continuar estudiando, porque no tengo los recursos necesarios. Si adquiero este préstamo mi vida cambiaria por completo porque con el lograría mi sueño de ser Bioanalista y  de ayudar a la sociedad.
Una de mis metas es terminar la universidad con meritos académicos, Otras de mis metas es ayudar a mi familia en especial a mi madre que me ha ayudado mucho. Mi sueño es ser una de las mejores  Bioanalistas del país para así poder ayudar a los más necesitados. Tengo planificado trabajar en el sector público y en el área industrial.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young bioanalysis student. She is requesting a loan to cover her educational expenses.

This is my story: "My name is Maribel. I am 23 years old. I was born in Moca and raised in La Vega. I am single. I live with my mother and two siblings. My father died and my mother is a housewife.

I am studying Bioanalysis at la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao UCATECI. I choose this field because I like it and it helps us to be more human and help people in real need. I have been studying in this program for two years and two quarters. I have taken 50 courses and what I liked most was Parasitology II.

I need this loan to be able to finish my studies as without it I will not be able to continue studying as I don't have the necessary resources. If I get the loan my life will be changed completely as I will realize my dream of becoming a Bioanalyst and be of use to society.

One of my goals is to complete university with academic merit. Another of my goals is to help my family and especially my mother who has helped me so much. My dream is to be one of the best Bioanalysts in the country and be able to help those most in need. I plan to work in the public sector and in industry".

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Pheap is 50 years old and a mother of four children. 

She grows rice on one hectare of land and she is a house builder to earn more income. 

This is Pheap's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a pumping machine to support her rice farm. 

Pheap hopes that she can get a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa habita en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, actividad en la que se inspiró después de hacer cursos de ventas y apoyada por una amiga que la ayudo en primera instancia refiriendola a estas empresas multinacioanles, esto ocurrio hace 3 años y su dinamismo no se detiene, porque le va muy bien, su meta hoy es liderar grupos de vendedoras para impulsar el multinivel. Aunque su desafío es recuperar la cartera de manera efectiva, con el fin de pagar sus cuotas mensuales, le ha ido muy bien, pero aun así, necesita tener un capital de trabajo adicional para incrementar la rotación de sus inventarios, ganar más y tener suficiente dinero disponible para responder a sus obligaciones. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios femeninos, ropa, artículos de papelería etc. Con esta inversión mejorará notoriamente sus inventarios y sus ingresos por venta mejorarán, con ellos apoyará mucho más a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 16 años,todo esto hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. e
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of Cartagena where she sells a variety of merchandise, through specialized guides or catalogs. She was attracted to this activity while taking sales courses and with the advice of a friend who helped Rosa get started, acquainting her with these multi-national corporations. This occurred three years ago and her dynamism has not ceased, and things are going well. Her goal today is to lead groups of vendors while promoting this multilevel enterprise.

Although Rosa's challenge is to recover her assets effectively, enabling her to repay her monthly quotas, matters has gone very well. However, Rosa still needs additional working capital if she is to increase the rotation of her inventories, earning more and having sufficient available money to respond to obligations. This is why, at present, she is applying to Kiva for her first financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, so that she can buy women's accessories, clothing, stationary, etc., to sell.

With this investment, Rosa's inventories will expand and her income from sales will improve. With these changes, she can provide more help for her family, composed of her husband and their three children, ages between 10 and 16 years. All this will make Rosa's Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: purchase women's accessories, clothing, stationary, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Srim's Group

texts.en:
Srim is a 48-year-old villager who lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a mother of 2 children. 

Srim overcomes her family’s hardship by farming rice and growing cassava. This is her first time borrowing with Kiva's field partner VisionFund. 

Srim is leading her group of 2 members in order to take their first loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost to plow her farmland. 

Srim hopes that she can earn more income in order to further improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost to plow her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and chips.

Adelina has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and chips

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: A local residing in Kratie province, Ny is 46 years old and a mother of three children. She earns income to support her family's needs by growing cassava on a five-hectare area and by working for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is Ny's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In this group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland and make it bigger than last year.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda una mujer trabajadora y responsable que lucha día a día para que su familia tenga lo necesario, Yolanda está muy agradecida por el crédito anterior que le ayudo  grandemente a incrementar su cultivo y cosechar una buena calidad de zanahoria, pero ahora ella quiere seguir prosperando con su cultivo por tal motivo ella solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá comprando semillas y fertilizantes para seguir incrementando el volumen de su  cultivo.
Ella tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente un crédito en Adicla, para que su cultivo incremente y pueda obtener sus ganancias y construir su casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking and responsible woman who strives each day to provide what her family needs. She is very grateful for her previous loan since it was a tremendous help with increasing her crop and producing a harvest of carrots that were of fine quality. Now she wants to continue prospering with her crop. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. This will help her continue increasing the volume of her crop.

Yolanda is hopeful of securing another loan from ADICLA so that she can increase her crops, generate income, and build a flat-roofed house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 47 years old, married and has one child. She wants to earn a living. That is why she engaged in making handicrafts as her business to provide for the needs of her family. She earns PHP 5,000 a month from this business, which helps them a lot for their living.

She joined just this year and borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional materials for making handicrafts so that she can make more products to sell.

Elma desires to expand her business and make it more productive to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mira is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Mira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old, is widowed and has eight children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Elsa has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Elsa has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice, drinks and water.

loans.name: Arther

texts.en:
Arther, aged 33 years old, is married with three children aged 10, 7 and 2 years old. Two of his children attend school at the moment. He sells cereals and farms from his rural area of residence, Rwajere, Burere, Bushenyi district, where his clients are traders.

He started his business to be able to generate income for his family, working eight hours a day and six days a week. He has applied for a loan of two million shillings (UGX1,500,000) to buy more stock for his business. He hopes to educate all his children to better their future.

He is faced with challenges of competition and limited working capital but is ready to boost his business after getting a loan, and continues working hard to achieve his long-term dreams through his hard work.

loans.use: to buy beans and millet for sale.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a 62-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonisa has a business of selling bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is 29 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, soap, etc.

Rea has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cyrillia Bull

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Cyrillia.  She is married, and has one child aged 7. 

In 2011, Cyrillia established her hair, cosmetics, and shoes business. She began her business just to help her husband in the running of the home. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,563,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy different types of hair, dozens of shoes, and cartons of cosmetics for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and add to her business capital. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business, to build a house, and to educate her child.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more hair, cosmetics, and some pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, corn flour, rice, cooking fat among other items

loans.name: Jenuario

texts.en: Jenuario is 59 years old and married with four children who are 25, 22, 20 and 18 years old. He is a tea farmer in his rural area of residence, Manengo, Kakoni, Kyamuhunga, Bushenyi, and his major client is a tea factory. He started his business in 1980 to be able to generate income for his family, working seven hours a day. He has applied for a loan of one million shillings (UGX 1,000,000) to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation. He hopes this will increase his yields and he will be able to own a big tea plantation in the future.  He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations and soil degradation of the tea plantations. He is ready to boost his tea plantation after getting a loan and is committed to continue working hard to achieve his long-term dreams. He appreciates the UGAFODE and Kiva partnership.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 106 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 106 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Actives et Commerçantes de la Commune. Il est composé de 5 femmes qui sont toutes dans le même marché et vendent les mêmes produits. Elles se réunissent chaque jour et faire des tontines. Elles évoluent dans la commercialisation des savons et de la lessive. Elles ont choisi comme présidente la dame Binetou, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Binetou sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des savons, de l'omo et de la lessive pour venir les vendre dans le marché de la localité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et souhaite à l'avenir avoir sa boutique de commerce générale. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter et diversifier ses produits, épargner de l'argent et afin améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 106 is a part of the Association of Merchants and Active Women in the Commune. It is made up of five women who all sell similar products at the same market. They meet each day to manage the savings group. 

These woman work selling soap and laundry detergent. They have chosen Binetou, who has her hand raised in the photo, to be their president. 

Binetou is seeking a loan to buy soap, Omo, and laundry detergent to sell in a local market. She starts her day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. She has done this for more than five years.

Binetou wishes to have a general store in the future so she can increase and diversify her products and save money. She [wants to be able to] improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soap and laundry detergent to resell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy bamboo, gasoline, fishing net, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, gasoline, fishing net, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Joeanne

texts.en:
Joeanne works hard to support her family. Joeanne is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Joeanne has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Joeanne would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc. to sell to her customers.  She has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF and has been running her store for two years. She earns additional income by buying and selling ready-to-wear items. Her goal is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Gemma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients such as sugar, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, etc. for her food-vending business.

Erlinda has been in this business for fifteen years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish and pig-fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as sugar, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Effie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Effie works hard to support her family.

She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Effie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Effie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nineteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school, She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk, and spices. Rona has been in this business for two years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children who earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to hire workers to help prepare her farm for planting. She supplements the income she earns on her farm by raising pigs, selling food and running a general store. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and plans to use this one to further build her businesses. Marivic dreams that one day  she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college and continue to expand her business

loans.use: to hire workers for her farm.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en: Analy is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Analy has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, and coffee. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 26 years old. She is married with two children, aged 1 and 4 years. 

She sells clothes and she has been in a business for the past four years, while her husband is a driver. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is 35 years, married with three children.  She is currently working with Bundibugyo district local Government, Uganda, as a primary school teacher. She took up the job because she is qualified for the profession, and it provides income in addition to what she earns from coca farming. In order to have several sources of income,Peluce has requested for a loan to start up a salon business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: To start up a salon business for raising additional income

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man aged 42 years with seven children who are 19, 17, 15, 13, 11, 9 and 7 years old respectively. He lives in a rural area with his family and six of his children are still attending school. He deals in agriculture, specifically growing coffee and passion fruit, and he supplements his family income with produce trading. He works six days a week and each day he works for 10 hours.

He started his business in 1990 with the aim of earning a living. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizer for his coffee and passion fruit plantation. His clients are traders from surrounding towns and his dream is to start a cattle grazing business but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital.

He describes himself as a hardworking man. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is 29 years and married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She is currently working with the Bundibugyo district local government, in Uganda as a primary school teacher. She took the job after training in the profession, and hopes to complete her house but is challenged by the low and delayed salary payment. Sylivia has requested a loan to buy building materials like iron sheets and timber to construct her house.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron sheets and timber to construct her house.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a business selling cashew-nuts, selling at the market to her neighbors and town-dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Mesaidi is requesting for a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is about 32 years old, married and has one child. He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything through his own sweat.

For the past twelve years, Sadi has traded in produce and done very well. He deals with coffee and cereal crop traders and those who run cotton gins in his area. He bought this pictured facility to enable him to hold more stock. He also owns rentals that bring in more income.

While his biggest business challenge is unfavorable weather conditions such as droughts and floods, according to Sadi he has been able to earn enough to take care of his family and child. He is now applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more dry corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is a 32-year-old woman from Tanzania. She has two children who go to primary school. When her children come back from school in the late afternoon, it already starts to get dark. In her village there is no electricity, so it becomes difficult for the children to read or to do homework in the evening. Erika wants to change that, she wants to bring solar energy not only to her village but to the whole district. She already did a class on renewable energies in Dar es Salaam where she learned the technical aspects of this technology. Now she needs to get a loan to start her business. The money will be used to buy solar home systems that she is going to sell in her village.

A Kiva loan will give Erika the opportunity to have a truly significant impact on her community.

loans.use: To build up her solar business and bring renewable energies to her village

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 43 ans. Divorcée, Adjo est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Adjo achète du bois qu'elle protège avec des couvertures dans sa maison et les revend à ses clients pour avoir son revenu nécessaire de subsistance. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bois, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité
texts.en:
Adjo is 43 years old and lives in Adidogomé.  She is divorced and has three children.  Adjo is a dynamic woman who works hard to ensure that her children are educated.  She buys firewood which she protects with blankets in her home and later sells to clients in order to make enough money to support her family.

Twice a month, she buys further supplies of firewood.  This is why she has requested this loan.

loans.use: to buy 3 loads of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Ndumbini S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Christine is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph; She is forty years old, married and a mother of four children and a member of Ndumbini S.H.G. She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household items. She is borrowing from Kiva to increase the stock in her general retail shop, which will enable her meet her customers' demands.

Christine is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap and cooking fat to increase stock of her general retail shop, which will enable her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the variety of products in her shop

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: As the single parent of two children, Delma works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines, and earns additional income by running a general store. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to  buy more items to sell. Delma has sustained her business with help from two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to secure the future of her family by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear items to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Ester has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Beatriz has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice and herbal medicine.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Liezel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fishing business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Annie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karina Kassandra

texts.es:
Karina tiene 21 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Virgen de Guadalupe.

Ella tiene una tienda de abastos y desea el credito para invertir en la tienda ya que se quedo sin trabajo, realiza las compras en Echeandia cada semana su sueño es tener casa propia, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades y en su tiempo libre le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Karina is 21 years old, she is single and lives with her parents in Echeandia, in the province of Bolivar. She belongs to the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank.

She has a general store and she wants the loan to invest in the store, because she was left out of work. She makes her purchases in Echeandia each week. 

Her dream is to have her own home. The challenges she faces are illnesses and in her spare time she enjoys dancing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store.

loans.name: Bladimir Armando

texts.es: Bladimir de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hermano desde hace varios años. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la albañilería, actividad que ha sido su apoyo para salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos económicos del hogar. Bladimir desea construir un muro en su vivienda, ya que actualmente está solo cuenta con un tapial de tela metálica lo que siente no es muy seguro, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro en su vivienda.
texts.en: Bladimir, 21 years old, has been living in his own house with his parents and brother for several years. He is a hardworking man who has been working in construction for 2 years. This activity has allowed him to make a living and to help his parents with the household expenses. Bladimir wants to build a wall in his house, since right now it has only a mud and wire mesh wall that he feels is not very sturdy. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a wall in his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Huor, 35, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a construction worker and earns, on average, USD 4.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for three years.
She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is single, aged 24 years old. To earn a living to help his parents, he is engaged in the motor transport business. He borrowed a loan again amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts for his motor maintenance so that his motorcycle will be in a good condition to cater to more passengers and earn more income.

In the future Jimmy wants to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor maintenance.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

Joy has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Elsie is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José, de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, está acompañado y pareja se dedica al oficio domestico, juntos han procreado un hijo, el cual asiste a la escuela.

José, aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura, debido a que no pudo seguir estudiando, es por eso que se dedico a trabajar junto a sus padres y sus hermanos mayores, ahora trabaja con su pareja.

El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar cinco sacos de abono, semilla fertilizante y pagar mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El sueño de José, es ayudar a su hija para que estudie una carrera universitaria y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
José, 24, has been farming for a long time. He is married and his partner works as a housewife. Together they have one child, who attends school.

José learned to work as a farmer, because he could not continue studying. So, he decided to work alongside his parents and his older brothers, and now he works with his partner.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy five bags of manure, seeds, fertilizer and to pay the labor costs to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

José's dream is to help his daughter so that she goes to university to become successful.

loans.use: to buy five bags of manure, seeds, fertilizer and to pay the labor costs to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se dedica a la agricultura, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico y juntos han procreado un hijo.

Juan, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al trabajo de la agricultura, todo lo que sabe acerca de este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, aunque hoy trabaja solo.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar insumos agricolas para sembra 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, porque se acerca la temporada de invierno, también pretende cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol.

Juan, pretende obtener muy buenas ganancias de la siembra de maíz y frijol en este invierno, porque sueña con poder comprar novillos de repasto y poner a estudiar a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 33 years old, studied to sixth grade. He works in agriculture and has a partner who works looking after the home, and together they have a child.

Juan has worked in agriculture for 20 years, he learned everything he knows from his parents but now he works alone.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs to seed 21,000 square metres of corn, as it is approaching the winter season. He also plans to grow 7,000 square metres of beans.

Juan hopes to obtain very good profits from the sowing of corn and beans this winter, because he dreams of buying grazing bulls, and of sending his daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to seed 21,000 square metres of corn and 7,000 square metres of beans.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru: Савринисо 53 летняя жительница района Кубадиен. Она замужем и имеет детей. Савринисо в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она 4 года продвигает растениеводством. Муж и дети тоже занимается этой деятельности. Савринисо серьезная и ответственная женщина. Сейчас ей надо подготовить землю  для нового посева урожая, но у Савринисо нет достаточных денег, чтобы приобрести минеральных удобрений, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей, вовремя закончит сев урожай. В будущем Савринисо хочет расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Savriniso is a 53 year old resident of the district of Qubadiyon. She is married and has children. Savriniso works in agriculture in this region. For four years, she has focused on horticulture. Her husband and children also work in this field. Savriniso is a serious and responsible woman. Now she needs to prepare the land for the sowing of the new crops, but Savriniso does not have enough money to acquire mineral fertilizers, and it is for this reason she applied for a loan. The requested amount would allow her to finish sowing the crops on time. In the future, Savriniso wants to expand her areas of work.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a business warrior. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are youth. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a bright life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 53 years old, married and has five children. She wants to provide her family a good living. She is engaged in the rice production business and earns an income monthly amounting to PHP 10,000. To have more production for her rice farm she borrowed again a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy organic fertilizer for the rice production.

Lilia wants to have a better income in the future to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the rice production farm.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a beauty salon and has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are loyal. She says that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations of beauty products.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she repaid her her previous loan successfully. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, beams and wooden planks to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a single man. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, flour, sugar, bread, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, sweets and other items. His business goal is to have a big retail business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, sweets and other items

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits, and she has been involved in this business for two years.

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are loyal. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and household items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and other household items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and other household items

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, sugar, salt, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of soda, sugar, salt, flour, bread and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have her own business premise. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of soda, sugar, salt, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Estelita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell for her buy and sell of vegetables and spices business.

Merlita has been in this business for six years. Merlita earns more income from farming rice.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is 60 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Diadema has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap,  and shampoo

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows, pigs, chicken, and sheep.

loans.name: Prelina

texts.en:
Prelina is 43 years old and married with three children. She started a vegetable gardening business to earn a living to help her husband in providing for their family.

With her previous loan, she has had a good repayment history because of her business; also, that helps her to pay her obligation in the coop. She decided to borrow another loan to purchase fertilizer for the vegetable garden to make her garden more productive.

Prelina plans to expand her business to give her family good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a marketable place, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle to add to his fleet. His business goal is to be able to sell motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle to add to his fleet

loans.name: Lenard

texts.en: Lenard is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells fish, sweets, and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low inventory. He will use the 35,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of fish, sweets, and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: buy more inventory of fish, sweets, and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a new variety of citrus to plant.

She supplements her income with earnings from selling food. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of citrus to plant

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juliet works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

Juliet is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mejumaa operates a stall where she sells vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo que es la alegría de su hogar. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios a una empresa cercana desde hace 10 años. Roberto desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en lámina galvanizada y hierro para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Roberto is  49 year old man who lives in his own house with his life companion and his son who is the joy of his house. He is a hard-working man who has been making his living working for a near-by company for the past 10 years. Roberto wants to change the roof of his house as it is in poor condition. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate and re-bar to change the roof of his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate and re-bar to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 11 años de edad al que apoya para que estudie. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de golosinas y productos congelados, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace 5 años, por lo que ha logrado tener una gran cantidad de cliente que siempre gustan de sus productos. María desea instalar puertas y ventanas en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas y ventanas para instalar en su vivienda y proteger de esta manera a su familia y sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: María is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her 11 year old daughter who she supports with her studies. She is a hard-working woman who works selling sweets and frozen products. She has been doing this from her house for the past 5 years. So she has manged to gain a great quantity of clients who always like her products.  María wants to install doors and windows on her house. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in doors and windows to install in her house and doing this protect her family and her few belongings.

loans.use: to invest in doors and windows to install in her house.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella owns and runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as biscuits, seasonings, coffee, sugar, canned goods, shampoo and toiletries. This is the source of her income. She is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, with one grown child. Her husband also has an income that will helps her meet their daily needs. She is applying for a loan to buy supplies, including canned goods, rice, soft drinks and many others. These will help improve the inventory of her store and attract more buyers. Thus, it will cause her daily sales to increase. In this way, Estrella can settle her obligations and able to expand her current business. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including canned goods, rice, soft drinks and many others, to sell on her store.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a good person. She operates a retail business, where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as transport. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell and to renovate her business premises. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is her third loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more inventory of fruits and vegetables and renovate her business premises.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has two children, 4 and 14 years old. He describes himself as industrious. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area for agriculture, and his primary customers are supermarkets and hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge as low inventory. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a water tank, pipes and sprinklers for irrigation. His business goal is to supply more markets within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will own a grocery store. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, pipes, and sprinklers for irrigation.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: 60-years-old Lydia lives in Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamoboanga Del Norte. She is married. Lydia joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000. The loan will be used as additional working capital in her existing business, to buy a variety of commodities to sell to the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta, 58, is married and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment her family's income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs. Norberta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them piece by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Norberta earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations at her general store she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items, such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuffs. Norberta is positive that as she expands her business it will boost her income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Norberta hopes to maintain and grow her business to enable her to save for old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Edelia

texts.en: As a single parent of two children, Edelia works hard to support her family. She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling food. Edelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pig-fattening business. Edelia has been sustaining her business activities with her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig-fattening business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is married, the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her most significant monthly expense is for food. For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling clothes from door to door, to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. With the KES 50,000 loan that she is applying for, she wants to buy bales of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en un comedor, actualmente ella está embarazada de su primer hijo.

José, es empleado en  una granja de aves desde hace 2 meses, antes trabajaba de ayudante de albañil y los trabajos los realizaba en la comunidad; además, siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz cerca de su casa.- Para ir a su trabajo se va en bicicleta todos los días y se tarda 10 minutos para llegar. 

El préstamo lo necesita para terminar de construir su vivienda, porque necesita poner las puertas, las ventanas de balcón, ponerle cemento al piso y pagar la mano de obra.- José, quiere tener su casa bonita y segura para que cuando nazca su hija, crezca en un ambiente saludable. 

El sueño de José, es que su hija nazca sanamente y seguir trabajando para brindarle lo necesario a su pareja y a su hija.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and studied up to grade 5. He is in a relationship and his partner works in a cafe. She is pregnant with her first child.

José has been an employee at a poultry farm for the past 2 months. Before that he worked as a bricklayer's assistant. His work is in his community. He also grows 10,500 sq. meters of corn close to his house. He gets to work by bicycle every day and it takes 10 minutes to get there.

He needs the loan to finish the construction of his house. He has to hang the doors, install the balcony windows, cement over the floor and pay for labor. José wants to have his house beautiful and secure when the baby is born, to grow in a healthy environment.

José's dream is for his daughter to be born healthy and continue to work to provide what is needed for his spouse and child.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his house as he has to hang doors, the balcony window, lay a cement floor and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a cashew-nut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mwanasha is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as passionate. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spares. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of auto spares.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells tuk tuk spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are tuk tuk owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tuk tuk spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tuk tuk spare parts.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is thankful that she was granted a 13,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Elvie dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 41-year-old single woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, running a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Adelaida has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old, married with two children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Helen has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Helen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 32 years old and has three children. Jeana is married and has two children are still in school.

Jeana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jeana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jeana has been in business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is 56 years old and married with five children. Ledesma works very hard to provide for them.

Ledesma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like soft-drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, egg, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Ledesma has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like soft-drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, egg, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Gerald Jean

texts.en:
Gerald Jean is 28 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Gerald Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Gerald Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, spice and other personal care products.

Gerald Jean has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, spice and other personal care products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman and has children. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water in Kaloleni. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby and even in the market place. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses and this is the reason as to why she wants to buy a freezer - to avoid her fish spoiling. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for use in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for use in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and she has school-going kids. She lives in a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mary operates a fruit and vegetable selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future for her to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of customer traffic fluctuation leading to some loss of perishable goods. In addition to her food stall, she also sells cashew nuts.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business. With this KES 35,000, she wants to purchase goods for her inventory, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her inventory, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are locals. 

Boniface describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, bread and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve other people's lives. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of stationery

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Amy has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Medelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Medelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Medelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 28 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.
