Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Felix is a man of 28 years of age, who serves as a loving father and farmer. 

Given that his earnings are not sufficient to cover his home expenses, he started a business that he works at, during the spare time that he has remaining, as a laborer on other farms, and it is the raising and selling of pigs for fattening. With this, he intends to improve the condition of his life and that of his family. As head of the household, he is responsible for all the home expenses, so he does not have much equity left to invest in his business.

It is for this reason that he requires a loan to buy pigs for fattening and feed. With these he can improve his sales and promote this business, getting more active in his micro-business, and making it appealing to the eye of customers, as pigs have more to offer.

His main dream is to be able to to generate good income, to not see his family want for anything, because that is something he lived through, and it affected him greatly. Therefore, he works tirelessly for his children and his wife. 

Support a farmer of the Colombian countryside with big dreams for his family!

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening and feed.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 36 years old and married with three children. With her three children currently in school, Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, milk, spices, and personal care products.

Arlyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, milk, spices, and personal care products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net, maintenance for her boat and other supplies for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, maintenance for her boat and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 61 years old, married and has four children.

Emma is in the agricultural pig raising business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emma has been in the business for 20 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ermenia

texts.en:
Ermenia is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ermenia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ermenia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, maintenance for her boat and other supplies for her business.

Ermenia has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, maintenance for her boat and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Bahudin

texts.en: Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Bahudin. Bahudin lives in East Serang, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Bahudin owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He is a hardworking man, and his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider. Bahudin decided to join Ruma last year because he wants to learn how to expand his business using technology. As the business grows, Bahudin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Bahudin’s goal in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Bahudin is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Evaline's Group

texts.en:
Evaline, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Evaline is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Evaline has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Evaline is planning to invest in a business.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Evaline's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Michell works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Michell is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Michell has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, aged 57, is the mother of seven children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a greengrocer by profession, and has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from his vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, his family's needs have suddenly increased and he does not have other income sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock by buying more fresh vegetables on a daily basis so he can maximize his sales of vegetables. Therefore, his mother, Rani has requested for a loan so that her son would be able to buy more fresh vegetable stock. Rani is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her son's business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamisi operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene es un hombre de 53 años de edad, casado, tiene una hija, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería.
Él es buen padre, paciente, emprendedor, razonable, consiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Copacabana’ que se encuentra ubicada en la zona este de la Ciudad, es un punto que articula el tráfico vehicular. Asimismo concentra comercios de distintos rubros. La zona también conocida como “La Villa” tiene muchas necesidades de infraestructura, servicios básicos, seguridad ciudadana, áreas verdes y campos deportivos para niños y jóvenes.
Rene es de tez morena, cabello gris corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con su hija que trabaja, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices de colores, cuadernos de todo tamaño, hojas de todo tipo, etc. Actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana en su librería ubicada en su mismo domicilio. “inicié mi negocio junto a mi esposa, nos va bien y trabajamos juntos…” comenta. La venta de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar por ser un sitio alejado, la desventaja es que el sitio es alejado y para reponer sus artículos deben viajar largos caminos. Su sueño es comprar una casa, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora para ofrecer otro servicio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rene solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora para ofrecer un nuevo servicio y con los beneficios comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Rene is 53 years old, he is married and has a daughter. His business is selling bookstore items.
He is a good father, he is patient, entrepreneurial, reasonable, consistent, responsible and hard working. He carries out his business in the area called 'villa Copacabana' which is in the eastern area of la Ciudad. It is a place where the traffic meets. It also has different types of businesses. The area is also known and 'La Villa' and it has a lot of need for infrastructure, basic services, security for the people, green areas and sports fields for children and young people. 
Rene is dark-skinned, short grey hair, brown eyes, is short and is of medium build. His native language is Aymara which he speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and also for his business. He shares his life with his wife who works in the same business and with his daughter who works. They live in a rented house built from bricks and cement with a roof made of corrugated iron. It has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system. His business is selling bookstore items such as coloured pencils, notebooks of all sizes, sheets of paper of all types, etc. He does this every day of the week in his bookstore situated in his home. He says 'I started my business with my wife, it is going well for us and we work together...'. The advantage of his business is that there is no competition in the area as it is a remote area. The disadvantage is that it is remote and so to get his products he needs to travel long distances. His dream is to have a home, he wants to expand his business by buying a photocopying machine in order to offer another service. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that he has been doing this work.
It is for these reasons that Rene is asking for a loan to buy a photocopying machine in order to offer a new service and then buy himself a house with the profits.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine to offer a new service and buy a house with the profits.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is a 49-year-old married woman with 10 children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cerlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cerlita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Cerlita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other supplies for her business and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Sira's Group

texts.fr: Sira qui se trouve assise sur la photo juste  à gauche, portant un habit rose et montrant la pochette myAgro avec sourire,  est membre d’un groupe de 4 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tenemambougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sira, âgée  de 40 ans, est la mère de 9  enfants dont 4  d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés .L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Sira  à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Sira cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice  à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie  et les matériels agricoles. Sira entame sa deuxième  année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite  en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l’impact positif qu’a eu la campagne précédente. Cette année, Sira effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectares. Cela fait maintenant 18 ans que Sira cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière et commerciale et pour le manque d’espace aussi. Sira planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu, de pouvoir prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et faire face aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Sira who is seated on the left in the photo wearing the pink outfit and holding a myAgro pouch with a smile on her face, is a member of a group of 4 female farmers signed up with myAgro, who all live and work in Tenemambougou village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Sira, who is 40 years old, is the mother of 9 children, 4 of whom have attended school at this point. Her family's tradition in farming, which has been the primary source of revenue and food for the household, is why Sira got started farming 30 years ago. Sira grows peanuts on her farm and faces challenges such as the lack of rain and agricultural materials. Sira is in her second year with myAgro, and signed up again because she wants to increase her yield through myAgro's services, and due to the positive impact myAgro had during the previous growing season. This year Sira is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts and increase her yield on her .125-hectare holding. It has now been more than 18 years since Sira started growing peanuts for their value as a staple and cash crop, and due to a lack of cultivable space. Sira plans to use her increased yield and revenue to be able to pay her children's school fees and manage family expenses.

loans.use: A packet of certified seed and fertliizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and married with five children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma works hard to support her family. Lerma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lerma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to pay for additional fish net, maintenance for her boat, and other supplies for her business.

Lerma has been in this business for two years, and she also earns income from raising pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for additional fish net, maintenance for her boat, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hard-working individual. Even though Judith is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Judith started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough money to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Judith’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Monzon's Group

texts.fr: Monzon, qui se trouve au deuxième rang, à l'extrême droite sur la photo, il porte une chemise wax, manche courte, est membre d'un groupe de 10 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Sankama, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Monzon, qui est âgé de 28 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 24 personnes dont 13 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Il a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour bonnes méthodes et techniques agricoles. Pour cette année Monzon a acheté avec MyAgro un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champs. A travers cet achat, Monzon espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir acheter un semoir et satisfaire les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Monzon is in the second row on the far right in the photo, and is wearing a wax print fabric shirt with short sleeves. He is a member of a group of 10 farmers who live and work in Sankama village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Monzon, who is 28 years old, lives in a family consisting of 24 people, 13 of whom are children. Farming allows him to take care of his whole family's food needs. He decided to sign up with myAgro in order to learn good methods and farming techniques. For this year Monzon purchased a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn on his fields. With this purchase Monzon hopes to be able to increase his yields and purchase a semoir (seed dosing machine) and meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Habi's Group

texts.en: Habi is second from the right in the photo in the black and white headscarf. She is a member of a group of 4 farmers who work and live in Faraba village southwest of Bamako in Mali. Habi is 40 years old and has 7 children, 5 of whom have been to school. Agriculture allows her to see to her family's food needs and pay her children's school fees. She decided to sign up with myAgro in order to learn good agricultural practices. For her second year with myAgro, Habi purchased a packet of certified seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts. With this purchase, Habi hopes to be able to produce higher yields in order to provide for her children's education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy a package of certified peanut seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being polite. 

Erastus operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. 

Erastus will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. He hopes that, in the future, he will become a renowned businessman. This is his fifth  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Fredrick, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married and has four children. Fredrick has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Fredrick isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Fredrick will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Using this loan, Fredrick's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Bata Group

texts.en:
Wanting to reduce her family's level of poverty, Ethel, a mother of two children, started obtaining loans. She greatly thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her, as she used the loan to buy bags of rice. Ethel happily testifies that this new business has significantly helped her to increase her profits.

Ethel would like to obtain another loan in order to buy more bags of rice. She hopes to send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Changbing

texts.en:
Changbing is a 53-year-old man. He and his wife are living with their mother, who is sick, and their grandsons. The couple is honest and hard-working.

Changbing and his wife were working in another place for many years. When they were informed that their mother was ill, they returned to their hometown and engaged in feeding pigs.

Changbing began to feed pigs five years ago. In those years, they used the income to build their house and set a methane tank. They led a happy big-family life.

This year, Changbing met a serious problem when his mother's condition worsened, which took a large amount of money for treatment. It put the family in a difficult situation, so Changbing requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred to buy more pigs and to cure his mother's disease. He hopes that his family can have an easier life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and cure his mother's disease.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline is a single woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

Jacquiline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will import clothes for sale. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in galvanized sheet metal, woods, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Iliana Marisol

texts.es: Iliana es una mujer de 20 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida en la casa de sus padres. Ella es una mujer admirable que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, por lo que se gana la vida como asistente de cosmetóloga, pero además en sus tiempos libres aprovecha para vender fruta partida y periódicos, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos, también su compañero de vida aporta a la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo. Iliana se siente feliz porque espera junto a su compañero de vida su primer hijo, pero ella desea tener un lugar propio para ofrecer a su hijo, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir su casa y de esta manera brindar un lugar propio donde vivir a su pequeño hijo. y de esta manera brindar un lugar propio donde vivir a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Iliana is a 20 year old women who lives together with her life partner in her parents' house.  She is an admirable woman who always looks for ways to get ahead.  She makes a living as an assistant cosmetologist, but in her free time she takes advantage and sells cut fruit and newspapers.  This allows her to get better income.  Also her life partner supports the economy of the house thanks to his job.

Iliana is happy because she waits together with her life partner for their first child.  But she hopes to have their own place to offer to their child.  It is for that that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to construct her house, and in this way offer their own place to live to their small child.

loans.use: To invest in cement, sand, gravel, brink, and iron to construct her house.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Vida works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming. Vida is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials such as bamboo sticks, nipa leaves and other materials for her nipa roofing business.

Vida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bamboo sticks, nipa leaves and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 50 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 70 years old, is married and has five children.

Samson likes to think of himself as a very hard-working individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Samson plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Samson’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 42-year-old widowed woman with six children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ruby has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net and other supplies for her business, and to maintain her boat.

Ruby has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and other supplies for her business, and to maintain her boat.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia Maritza pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS.
La socia continua dedicándose a  la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y también a la venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member Maritza belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" (Queen of the Angels of Urquillos.)

Maritza continues making a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens and also sells vegetables.  She is a responsible and earnest woman.  She wants to be able to continue working and therefore be able to continue supporting her family.

Maritza is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs.  She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself as honest.

Mary operates a retail business where she sells agrovet products. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funds and will use this Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of seeds for resale. 

Mary's business goal is to have a well-known business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business greatly and give her children a good education. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of seeds for resale.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is an industrious woman selling kettle corn.  Aside from that, she is also a dealer of a personal collection products ranging from personal care to baby needs and essentials and home care needs. She has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for almost six years. 

She is a married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol.  Two of her children are still attending school. 

Remedios has requested a loan to buy more supplies of ready made kettle corn and purchase personal collection stock. 

With these, she could attend the orders of her respective customers and able to augment her daily income. Thus, she would expand her business and able to handle her finances. She could now prepare nutritious meals for the whole family. 

In the future, Remedios is hoping that she could manage her business successfully for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of ready made kettle corn and purchase personal collection  stock

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Pasay City, Metro Manila. She is 53 years old and has two children, one who is at school and the other one at work. With her husband Jose, a painter, she is able to earn for a living for her family through a buy-and-sell business that she manages.

Her business basically involves buying goods from wholesalers and then selling them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from frozen foods to biscuits and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Marivic is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and will use her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she dreams to prosper through her business and to give her child a better education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With this loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for her store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nelly has a buy and sell gravel and sand business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sand, cement, gravel and other construction materials to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sand, cement, gravel and other construction materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Tufaniso

texts.en:
Tufaniso is a hardworking woman. She has 12 years experience doing business in agriculture. Tufaniso was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984 and is married with three children. Her husband is busy with beekeeping and also sells fish. Tufaniso is a farmer who plants vegetables and cereals. Her family has bad living conditions and she has a goal of helping her husband to increase the family budget. Tufaniso is a goal-oriented, generous, and wise woman who would like to have a good harvest. 

Tufaniso is requesting a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals for her land. Her loan is important to her because it will help her to live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals

loans.name: Herbert

texts.es:
El socio Herbert pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS“.
El socio continua con su negocio de una panificadora, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, mantequilla entre otros.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member Herbert belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" (Queen of the Angels of Urquillos).

Hebert continues with his bakery business.  He is a responsible and earnest person.  He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family.

Herbert is requesting the loan to buy flour, yeast, butter, among other things.  He is happy about the loan and he promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, butter, among other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman who has three children. For the past four years, she has operated a business selling vegetables and fish. Elizabeth describes herself as focused. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are locals. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes to expand in the future and her business goal is to open another shop within five years. This will be Elizabeth’s first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria is a married woman with seven children. She is 60 years old and has one child that is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
Patria has a buy and sell seafood business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood such as crabs, oysters, shrimp and other seafood to sell.

Patria has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood such as crabs, oysters, shrimp and other seafood

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has retail seafood business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood such as crab, oyster, shrimp and more to sell to her customers.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years now, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood such as crab, oyster, shrimp and more to sell to her customers

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and she thanks God for her life.

She has operated a food vending business for the past three years, cooking chapati (flat bread) and rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Glory thanks Kiva for the support they are giving to marginalized people.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business

loans.name: Zhiyong

texts.en:
Zhiyong is a 21-year-old single man who runs a barbershop with three employees. Zhiyong was born in a poor family, and when he was a little kid, his parents divorced. His mother raised him alone. The poor family had no chance to let him accept higher education, so when he finished his high school education, he delved into society early. He used three years to learn hair dressing skills, and then last year he set up his own barbershop, which cost all of his savings from those years.

With hard work and diligence, his barbershop goes on very well. Zhiyong is an honest and warm-hearted boss, so that his staff is willing to keep working for him. This year, they paid for a lot of facilities, which taken an amount of money.

Zhiyong has requested ￥10,000 form Micorcred. It is the first loan of him. He wants to use the money as rent payment, so that they can make enough money to make their lives better. Zhiyong believes that he could use his energy and hard work to create a wealthy living circumstance for his future.

loans.use: to pay rent on his business space

loans.name: Jonelle

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Jonelle has engaged in cooking and selling foods through a food stall in her community at Pasay City for almost 20 years. Along with her husband Angelico, she tries to provide all the needs of the family on a daily basis. 

To further expand her business, she would like to avail a new loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork and chicken, as well as seasonings that are needed in her regular recipes. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Jonelle hopes that through this business she will be able to meet her family’s needs leading to a more affordable life. She also wants to add more business someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Santa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera de 2 niños, ya que su esposo la abandono y solo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Carmen, es una persona que ha sufrido mucho, pero eso no la ha detenido para superarse; ella posee mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz y frijol, todo lo que sabe de agricultura lo aprendió de su padre, porque desde pequeña le ayudaba a realizar la siembra de estos cultivos.- Así como también fue aprendiendo a criar ganado, ya que su padre también tenía experiencia en esto.- Ahora Carmen, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, de esta forma asegura parte de la alimentación de su familia para el próximo año.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cultivar maíz, de esta forma Carmen podrá continuar trabajando.

Carmen, sueño con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35 years old, studied until the 3rd grade.  She is a single mother of two child.  Her husband abandoned her, and she alone has managed to raise her children.

Carmen is a person who has suffered a lot, but that has not stopped her for overcoming it.  She has a lot of experience in planting corn and beans.  All that she knows about agriculture she learned from her father, because since she was young she used to help him plant these crops.  This was also how she learned to raise cattle, since her father also had experience in this.  Now Carmen plants 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans.  In this way she secures part of the food for her family for the next year.

The loan will be used to buy necessary fertilizers for growing corn so that Carmen can continue working.

Carmen dreams of improving the quality of life for her family and having more cattle.

loans.use: To buy necessary fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various retail items

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Chinche Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EMPRENDEDORAS DE CHINCHE, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bernardina tiene 65 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cultiva fruta como platanos, naranjas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "EMPRENDEDORAS DE CHINCHE". The bank is located in the district of Maranura, province of La Convención and department of Cusco. Bernardina is 65 years old. She has 3 children and is a widow. She alternates her daily activities with the business of agriculture. She has been working for a long time in this business which is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts every day in her business. She grows fruits such as bananas and oranges, among other products. This is the way in which she supports her family. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure. The members are grateful for the given loan and they promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia Eugenia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS.
La socia tiene 54 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower Eugenia belongs to the communal bank “Reyna De Los Angeles De Urquillos.”  She is 54 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily chores and the agriculture business.  She is a responsible and determined person.  She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure.  She is happy for this loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Rutina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HABASPATA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rutina tiene 51 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the HABASPATA communal bank that is located in the Vilacabamba district, in the province of La Convención in Cusco. Rutina is 51 year old and has 3 children.  She works in a restaurant, which she has owned for a long time.  Thanks to her daily efforts, the business has gone well for her and it is her means for getting her family ahead.

She is seeking a loan to purchase more supplies such as rice and oil among others.  She is very grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice, oil and others.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 38 years old, and her three children are presently in school.

Rosemarie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish net and other materials for her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for fifteen years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HABASPATA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Martha tiene 31 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the HABASPATA communal bank that is located in the Vilcabamba district of the province of La Convención in Cusco. Martha is 31 years old and has 1 child.  She works in a restaurant, which she has owned for many years.  The business is going well for her thanks to her daily efforts, and it is her means of getting her family ahead.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as rice and oil, among others. She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice and oil among others.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU HUAMANGA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Zenovia tiene 38  años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de extracción de madera, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de bienes de consumos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Apu Huamanga communal bank, located in the Lares District of the Province of Calca in Cusco. Zenovia is 38 years old and is a single mother of two children.  She works as a logger, which she has been doing for many years.  Thanks to her daily efforts her business has been going well and it has allowed her to get her family ahead. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar and milk among other items. She is very grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU HUAMANGA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Roxana tiene 32 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de bienes de consumos como arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Apu Huamanga communal bank, located in the Lares district in the province of Calca in Cusco. Roxana is 32 years old and has 1 child.  She works in a restaurant, which she has owned for many years. Thanks to her daily efforts, it has gone very well for her and allowed her to get her family ahead.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items. She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, oil and others.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She is 31 years old and she resides with her family in Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for four years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner, Welfredo, are working hard with the determination to have a better income, and be able to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Melanie would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Melanie hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her children to finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mulanda

texts.en:
Mulanda is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, rice, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, bread, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU HUAMANGA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Enriqueta tiene 53 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Apu Huamanga communal bank, located in the Lares district of the Province of Calca in Cusco. Enriqueta is 53 years old and has 1 child. She works as a farmer, which she has been doing for many years.  Thanks to her daily efforts, her business has been going very well, which has allowed her to get her family ahead. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase manure and seeds. She is very grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase manure and seeds.

loans.name: Saide

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HABASPATA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Saide tiene 45 años de edad tiene 02 hijos  y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank HABASPATA. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, province of La Convención and department of Cusco. Saide is 45 years old. She has 2 children and is separated. She alternates her daily activities with the restaurant business. She has worked for a long time in this business and is doing very well thanks to the hard work she devotes daily to her business, being the way she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy inputs such as rice, oil, among other things. Saide is grateful for the given loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as rice, oil, among other things.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and bread, and personal care products.

Vilma has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and bread, and personal care products.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo es albañil.

Teresa, trabaja desde la edad de 16 años, inicio vendiendo ropa en el negocio de su madre, ahora siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y además coloco una pequeña tienda, su esposo le ayuda.
	
El crédito será invertido para comprar arroz, azúcar, pan, café, jabón, frijoles, entro otros productos para la tienda.

El sueño de Teresa, es tener hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old, studied up to the first grade, is married and doesn't have any children.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Teresa has worked since she was 16 years old, at first selling clothing in her mother's business.  Now, she cultivates 7,000 square metres of corn and also has a small store.  Her husband helps her.
	
The loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, bread, coffee, soap, and beans among other products for her store.

Teresa's dream is to have children and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, coffee, soap, and beans among other products for her store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Nancy, who is a 43-year-old smallholder farmer from Kericho in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Nancy owns a one-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. She keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has seven years of experience in farming. 

Nancy is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She intends to buy farm seeds and fertilizers that she will use in her horticulture farm.

She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Nancy. 

Through a group of 16 members called Rautet, Nancy has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. 

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Nancy because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

If, lenders, you were to support someone with a loan, then that person is Nancy!

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Patricia who is a 28-year-old smallholder farmer from the Kericho area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Patricia owns a 1-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This kind mother keeps dairy animals and grows varieties of crops and tea. She has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Patricia is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm.She intends to buy more farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings that will help her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Patricia. 

Through a group of 15 members called Samaria, Patricia has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. 

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Patricia because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. 

Kindly help this heroine out!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anne's Group

texts.en:
Anne, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than thirty years, and is now proud to represent her group of ten farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 60 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Anne likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Anne plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Anne’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a toilet to guarantee hygiene and comfort inside his house

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 12 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 36 years old, married, and has 6 children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. 

Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest.

loans.name: Ivetya

texts.en:
Ivetya lives with her husband and son in Gavar in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. She is 51 years old, and she can definitely claim to be a master beekeeper. 

On her farm Ivetya has 70 hives of bee. Her husband and son help her considerably with both taking care of the bees and selling all the honey produced by their farm. Ivetya mentions that her bees make fantastic honey, as it is very healing, pure, and smells like a bouquet of flowers from the field where her bees make their honey. 

In the spring and autumn months Ivetya gathers the honey, and throughout the year, she sells it to her regular customers, neighbors, and re-sellers from the city. She is very happy, and she likes her everyday work with her bees. 

With this loan amount Ivetya would like to buy many new families of bees. She is sure that by developing her beekeeping activities she will earn a better living and gain many new customers.

loans.use: to buy new families of bees.

loans.name: Gaitano's Group

texts.en:
Gaitano is 64 years old and has 9 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Gaitano has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (a maize virus), he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gaitano also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gaitano's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 11.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Narinder

texts.en:
Narinder thanks all the Kiva lenders for helping him in his financial need.
He has repaid his previous loan fully and on time and with the profits he could save for his family's future.
Narinder wants to save for a rice plot and for this he must continue with rice cultivation. To buy inputs such as diesel oil, fertilizers and pesticides, Narinder needs a loan of SRD 10.000.

loans.use: to purchase diesel oil, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо 44 летняя жительница не большого района под названием А.Джоми. Она замужем и имеет дочку. Ее муж находится за приделами Родины на заработках. Гулинисо предоставляет услуги по шитью одежды. В работе в основном ей помогает ее дочка. Гулинисо выдает замуж дочку и на заемные средства хочет приобрести приданное для дочки. Гулинисо надеется, что сможет совершить задуманное благодаря кредиту.
texts.en: Gulniso is 44 years old and lives in a small region called A. Jomi. She is married and has a daughter. Her husband works abroad. Gulniso provides sewing services and her daughter helps her with this work. Now her daughter is getting married and Gulniso must cover the wedding expenses. Gulniso is taking out a loan to provide a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a dowry for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, beams, pins, and wire so that he can replace the roof over the corridor of his home.

loans.name: Ligia Margarita

texts.es:
Ligia, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, luego estudio un curso en cosmetología, es madre soltera de 2 hijos y vive sola junto a los dos niños.

Ligia, despues de haber culminado sus estudios, cuando tenía 20 años de edad, decidió colocar una venta de pupusas frente al parque del pueblo, pues no había nadie que vendiera comida típica, al principio era tan solo una ramada, fue después de un año que logro colocar la infraestructura de un cafetín, en el que lleva 9 años trabajando.

El préstamo solicitado es para invertir en compra de insumos y mercadería para reactivar su venta de pupusas, pues había cerrado durante 3 meses, porque habían retirado a todos los vendedores del parque, porque se acercaban las votaciones para elegir al alcalde, también quiere invertir una parte para comerciar ropa en los cantones y caseríos aledaños a su pueblo.

Ligia, sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo, de forma que pueda tener otros locales de venta de comida y también desea vender ropa, porque le generara mayores ingresos y así gozar de una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Ligia is a single mother of two children who live with her. She is a tenacious woman with a high school education who has also studied cosmetology. 

Ligia finished her studies at the age of 20, and decided to start a business. She began selling pupusas [tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] next to a park in her town, in a spot where there were no other food vendors. She sold from a cart for the first year, but then was able to set up the small cafe that she's run for the past nine years.   

The cafe has been closed for three months because a mayoral election campaign forced the withdrawal of all vendors from the park. Ligia is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise to restart the business. She also wants to invest part of the loan funds in starting a business selling  clothing in the neighborhoods and towns near her home.  

Ligia hopes that her business will continue to grow. She'd also like to open new cafes and clothing shops so that she can earn more income and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise to restart pupusa sales.

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en:
Masuda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1985 in a small town. She is married with 2 children and lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. Her husband is an emigrant and works in Russia. 

Masuda is an honest, responsible, and intelligent person. She is a sewer and makes traditional women's dresses for her permanent clientele. She wants to have a good and productive business. 

Masuda requires a new sewing machine because it would help her to keep active with a more productive business. She is requesting a loan to buy the new sewing machine, and she hopes her request will be supported by Kiva's lenders. 

Masuda plans to work hard, remain busy, and attract a lot of customers. Improving her business would help her to live better. Her husband does not earn enough to send her money from Russia. So she needs to help her husband with supporting their child by earning a living from her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will buy materials to build a bathroom and install a toilet.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, de 37 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja es comerciante de frutas y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. 

Luis, es empleado, tiene muchos años de trabajar en la misma institución; pero también es agricultor, cultiva maíz y frijol, su esposa se involucra en los cultivos.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar cemento, arena y hierro, para construir un cuarto en su casa, todo para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Luis, sueña con tener su casa en buenas condiciones para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old and in a relationship. His partner is a fruit merchant and they have two children who are in school.

Luis is employed and has worked many years for the same institution. He is also a farmer who grows corn and beans. His wife is involved with attending to the crops as well.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of cement, sand, and iron so that he can build a room in his house. All of this will be done so that he can improve his quality of life. Luis dreams of having a house that is in good condition so that he can provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and iron so that he can build a room in his house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She is a hairdresser and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair chemical relaxers, chairs, and shampoo. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. She aspires to buy a fridge to start selling.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair chemical relaxers, chairs, and shampoo

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widowed woman. She has five children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking oil, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a nice place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. 

She will use the 55,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Guadalupe Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal RETROCEDER NUNCA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Guadalupe tiene 55 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias ejerciendo su carrera de enfermera, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a ejercer su profesión el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar como arroz, aceite, leche, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The ,member belongs to the "RETROCEDER NUNCA" communal bank which is located in Santa Ana district, in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Guadalupe is 55 years old, is separated and has 4 children. She combines her daily activities with her nursing career. She has been exercising her profession for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. This is the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy food for her home like rice, oil, milk, sugar amongst others. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, oil, milk and sugar amongst others.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick is a married man who engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been engaged in fishing for three years now. He is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol.  He is 36 year old with three dependents, ages 15, 12 and 10 years old. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials like a fishing net. These tools are very essential in augmenting his ongoing catch. He will be able to sell a larger volume of fish to the locals in his town. 

With this loan, he would be able to continue to support the needs of his growing children and also expand his fishing livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like a fishing net

loans.name: Alcira Alcione

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal RETROCEDER NUNCA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alcira tiene 42 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen  dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de polos, camisas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the RETROCEDER NUNCA communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, province of La Convención and  department of Cuzco.

Alcira is 42 years old. She has 2 children and is in a common law marriage. She alternates between her daily activities and her clothes selling business. She has been doing this business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. This is the way that she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts and more. She is thankful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, and more.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself as positive minded. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 60 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella lleva aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la sastrería. Confecciona camisas, pantalones, cortinas, ropa de cama, faldas, forros de muebles etc. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área de la confección. Además compra y vende ropa como blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones etc. Ella ha obtenido varios prestamos en ODEF, los que le han ayudado a mantener el negocio. El préstamo actual es por 10,000 lempiras y lo utilizará para comprar ropa como jeans, short, blusas, faldas etc. para vender. Su meta es mantener activo su negocio y seguir creciendo como comerciante para vivir del negocio.
texts.en: María is 60 years old. She is a single mother. She has 4 children and and lives in the town of  Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. She has been a seamstress for 30 years. She makes shirts, pants, curtains, bed clothing, skirts, slipcovers, etc. She has a lot of experience in the area of sewing. She also buys and sells clothing such as blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, etc. She has taken out several loans in ODEF, which has helped her to maintain her business. The current loan is for 10,000 lempiras and she ill use it to buy clothing like jeans, shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. to sell. Her goal is to stay active in her business and keep growing as a merchant to make a living from the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as jeans, shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in the village of Zovaber in Gegharkunik region. Vardan lives with his father, wife, and pretty daughter. He is engaged in farming and agriculture with his father. With his first Kiva loan, Vardan managed to enrich his farm with cattle, and now he has more calves on his farm. He also has cows, sheep, lambs, and chickens. Vardan’s wife organizes their farm product sales such as milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, and eggs. The sale of meat is Vardan’s father's duty. Vardan also properly takes care of his land, which is rather big; on it he cultivates vegetables and fruits and also gathers from it hay for his farm cattle. Vardan used to have a hay mowing machine with which he worked very quickly, but now it is broken down and it cannot be repaired.

With this loan of 700.000 AMD, Vardan will buy a new hay mowing machine for his agricultural activities. Vardan paid back his previous Kiva loan and again has need of Kiva's support. He hopes that this time also he will have it.

loans.use: to buy a new hay mowing machine for his agricultural activities

loans.name: Anonymous
