Fedha  thinks of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has worked with One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Fedha plans to use the profits  to send his children to school.

Fedha’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land and receive 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna, pictured above, has been a farmer for 8 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers from the Kakamega South District. She is 62 years old, married and has 5 children.

Edna likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Edna plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Edna’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest.

loans.name: Ninyamaye

texts.en:
Ninyamaye is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for three years to  sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge getting customers to pay on time.

She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pedro Manuel

texts.es:
Pedro, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Tierra Alta, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Pedro solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 5 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto con gran vocación de trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is a farmer with many dreams and aspirations in life. He wants to get ahead with his family through his hard work. This is why he started raising pigs, a very common activity in Tierra Alta, a municipality known for the good quality and prices of its pigs.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy pigs in order to fatten them and sell them. His only objective is to get ahead and take care of his family, who are the reason why he is hardworking and persistent.

Pedro works hard in different activities, five hours every day. He is a man devoted to his work, and a go-getter.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Xanoglan

texts.en:
Xanoglan is  married and has three children. All of his children go to school. Xanoglan’s family is living in the Fuzuli region but for the past 22 years, they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. 

Xanoglan has been in the animal breeding business for many years. This is his second loan. He paid back the first loan on time. Summer is coming and he wants to vaccinate his animals. Therefore he has requested a loan in amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Xanoglan is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this help. In the future, he wants to start producing and selling dairy products.

loans.use: to vaccinate his animals.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Mirzoali is a polite, honest and patient person. He is 22 years old. He is not yet married.  Mirzoali has a secondary school education.  

He has his own business.  He sells men's clothing at the market. He started this activity a few years ago with the help of his brother. 

Now, Mirzoali wants to buy clothing at wholesale prices to re-sell. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money.  For this reason, Mirzoali wants to obtain a loan and expand his business. He hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices and expand his business.

loans.name: Gulsevar

texts.ru:
Гулсевар серьезный и ответственный человек. Ей 39 лет. Гулсевар жительница района Кубодиён. Она замужем и имеет детей. К сожалению, ее муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Гулсевар в родном районе занимается растениеводством. Этой деятельностью она занята более 3 года. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честно нажитым трудом. Гулсевар сейчас хочет обработать землю с минеральными удобрениями вперед посадки урожай. Смешанная почва  минеральными удобрениями  помогает получить   качественный и богатый урожай.  Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает суммы денег, и по этой причине Гулсевар обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Gulsevar is a serious and responsible person. She is 39 and lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is married and has children. Unfortunately, her husband is currently located far from his family - he is working in Russia.

Gulsevar works in agriculture in her native region, an occupation she has had for more than three years. She likes this work since it allows her to earn money through honest work. Right now she wants to fertilize her land before planting crops. Amending the soil with mineral fertilizers will help her receive a good and rich harvest. But she doesn't have enough money to buy these fertilizers, and for this reason she is looking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, no estudio, está soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven en su casa y los otros están acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares, en su casa también vive su mamá. 

Blanca, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de 8 años y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, para buscar un ingreso económico extra para su familia y además para mantenerse ocupada.- También trabaja la agricultura, antes era empleada doméstica. 

Blanca, necesita el crédito para alquilar un terreno para sembrar, de esta manera asegurar el lugar donde sembrará, porque si no el dueño del terreno se lo alquila a otra persona y además podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca didn't go to school. She is single and has four children, of whom only two live in her house. The others are married and have their own households. Her mother also lives in her house.

Blanca works with grazing cattle,  She has done this for more than 8 years, and she learned it on her own initiative in order to seek an extra economic income for her family and in addition to keep herself busy. She also works in agriculture. Previously, she was a domestic employee.

Blanca needs the loan to rent a plot of land to plant and in this way to be sure of the place where she will plant, because if she doesn't, the owner of the land will rent it to another person. In addition, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

Her dreams are to continue working in order to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land to plant

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor tiene 40 años de edad es soltero trabaja jornadas nocturnas en una fabrica, desde hace tiempo empezó a presentar una molestia en su ojo derecho presentando una lesión en la conjuntiva ocular. Desde que le detectaron el padecimiento utiliza gotas y pomadas, actualmente la lesión es muy molesta ya que esta ocasionando intensos dolores en su ojo, así como resequedad. La solución a su padecimiento es una extirpación quirúrgica lo que vendría a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: This man is 40 years old and single.  He works night shifts at a factory.  Some time ago he started to have a problem with his right eye, an injury to the conjunctive membrane.  Ever since they found the condition he has been using drops and ointments.  The injury is very distressing because it causes intense pains, like dryness, in his eye.  The solution to his problem is surgical removal, which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Mathayo's Group

texts.en:
Mathayo is a 62-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mathayo has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Mathayo described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Mathayo’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Amka S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rosemary. She is the administrator at Amka Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mbuya in Kampala with 500 students.

Amka School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an ultra-filtration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase the ultra-filtration water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Amka School will repay its loan from school fees, which it collects each term. Rosemary ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 32 years old. She has been married for seven years and has a child. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region with her family, but they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. 

She has been in an animal breeding business. Tarana prepares dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.) to sell in a local bazaar. Her stall for cows has collapsed, and today, Tarana needs 2,300 AZN for building a new stall. 

She is thankful to Komak and Kiva. She wants to increase her business and monthly income in the future. She wants give a higher education to her child.

loans.use: to build a new stall for her cows

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells items like powdered juice, biscuits, candies, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings, canned goods and soap. He is a 41-year-old married man with four young dependents.  He has been operating a sari-sari store for more than 10 years. 

Allan has requested a loan to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, soft drinks, tissue paper, rice and other supplies. These are very important tools in the improvement of his daily earnings. With these, he could be able to earn more and start to expand his business. Thus, he could prepare healthy foods for the whole family. 

With the additional capital, he is determined to handle his business successfully to become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, soft drinks, tissue paper, rice and other supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 34. She is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. Married to Rolando, she manages their own household while operating the business. She works to help provide income for their daily expenses.

Rosalie is into the buying and selling of slippers and makes and sells snacks, as well. She buys different kinds and styles of slippers from a wholesaler and sells them at a retail price at her small store by her house. She also makes snacks for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy dozens of slippers to expand her product inventory. With part of the loan, she will pay for ingredients for her snacks business. This will definitely boost her earnings as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and a good return on her investment, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance. 

Rosalie hopes to be able to expand her business and have her own place to sell her snacks. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different kinds and styles of slippers to sell and ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week.

Imelda has requested for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, braids, weaves, and shampoo. Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages, which affect her work. Her goal and aspiration is to buy better salon seats. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, treatments, braids, weaves, and shampoo.

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en:
Hikmat has cows. He has been in the animal raising business for nine years. Hikmat is married and has two children. His elder son is 17 years old, graduated school last year, and is preparing for university. His daughter is going to musical school; she plays the piano well. His lovely wife helps Hikmat on their family business. 

They are living in the Fuzuli region, but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home, which was Fuzuli city. 

Today, Hikmat needs a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to vaccinate newborn animals. In the future, he wants to build a new stall for his cows.

loans.use: to vaccinate the animals and increase business

loans.name: Valentin Antonio

texts.es:
Valentin es un hombre de 43 años de edad fuerte, trabajador, humilde y servicial lleva trabajando en su finca gran parte de su vida y todos sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a su familia que realizan actividades similares. 

Padre de dos hijos a los cuales quiere educar con las buenas costumbres del campo pero tratando de que pueda acceder a una buena educación y no le toque un trabajo tan pesado para sobrevivir pues no cualquier persona ejerce esta profesión. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos, semillas y cerdos buscando mejorar y aumentar su producción pues es soñador y piensa es darles a sus hijos todas las herramientas para forjar un excelente futuro al igual que mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Valentin, age 43, is strong, hard-working, humble, and helpful.  He has been working on his farm for a big part of his life.  He gained all of his knowledge thanks to his family.  They engage in similar business activities.  He has two children, whom he wants to raise with the good customs of the country.  However, he wants them to be able to access a good education and not have to do such heavy work in order to survive.  Not just anyone engages in this profession.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation, seeds, and pigs.  He is looking to improve and increase his production.  He is a dreamer, and he plans to give his children all of the tools to forge an excellent future.  He also plans to improve the condition of his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation, seeds, and pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 6 farmers from the Kakamega South District. She is 43 years old, married and has 7 children.

Beatrice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013.  She decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Beatrice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Beatrice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis con un gran espíritu trabajador y aventurero, se dedica a la pesca y a la cría de pollos junto con su madre (Ver Foto) desde hace 14 años con una meta fija que es la de poder salir adelante y poder construir junto a su familia un buen futuro.

Es soltero, emprendedor y muy trabajador

Labora todos los días en sus negocios durante jornadas de 8 horas en busca de una buena pesca y producción de huevos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras.

Estos animales le permitirán tener una mejor esperanza de trabajo y de progreso.

Ayuda a un humilde pescador de las tierras colombianas con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Luis, with a great hard-working and adventurous spirit, has been working in fishing and in raising chickens along with his mother (see the photo) for 14 years, with the fixed goal of being able to get ahead and to build a good future with his family. 

He is single, entrepreneurial, and very hard-working.

He works every day in his businesses during 8-hour workdays, in search of a good fish and production of eggs.

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of chickens to raise and laying hens.

These animals will allow him to have a better hope for work and for progress.

Help a humble fisherman from the lands of Colombia with a loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and laying hens.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mesaidi operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 53-year-old, proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Jane has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Jane described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Vuth, 41 years old, is a widow mother of three children who are all dependent children; one among them is in school, while the others are too young to go to school. She lives in the Bovel district of Battambang province. The main source of her family’s income has been from chickens for sale for five years, and to earn more income, she also works for other farms for a fee, as well. She could earn around 25,000 KHR per day for her family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Vuth’s group, which consists of three members, with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She formed a group to borrow this loan, and with her portion, she will buy food for feeding the chickens. She hopes that she could earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food for feeding the chickens

loans.name: Samphors' Group

texts.en:
Samphors is a 27-year-old married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She is a resident in a rural area located in Sieam Bouk district of Steung Treng province. The sources of her family’s income are generated from potato farming and soybean farming, which earn her around 61,000 KHR per day.

This is the second loan for Samphors’s group, which consists of three members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped Samphors to earn more income and have enough food to eat. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with a portion to be used to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. Samphors hopes that she can earn more money and have enough food and consumables to use.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its patients.

loans.name: Dúo Getsemaní Group

texts.es:
Dúo Getsemaní
Esta integrádo por las señora Felipa siendo la representante sigue motivada para seguir trabajando, doña Felipa ve una buena fecha para su negocio el acercamiento del día de las madres, en su caso doña Felipa teje servilletas, elabora la costura a los cortes típicos de las mujeres de San Juan, también ofrece fajas  y güipiles típicos, es por eso que doña Felipa solicita nuevamente le brinden la oportunidad de apoyo para que ella logre la compra de lana he hilos de diversos colores  para elaborar las servilletas, su anhelo y su deseo es seguir trabajando para apoyar a su única hija quien este año ha iniciado su carrera a nivel medio.
texts.en:
The Getsemani duo includes Señora Felipa. who is the representative. She continues to be motivated to continue working. Doña Felipa sees a good time for her business with the approach of Mothers' Day. In her case, Doña Felipa weaves napkins. She makes the typical clothing of the women of San Juan. She also offers skirts and traditional huipiles (blouses). 

It is for this reason that Doña Felipa is applying again to be offered the opportunity for support so that she can complete the purchase of wool yarn of various colors to make the napkins. 

Her wish and her desire are to continue working to support her only daughter, who this year began her secondary school program.

loans.use: to buy the basic supplies to make weavings to sell.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is a single mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and bills. 

She makes cassava, cabbage and potato chips at the market and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, Irish potatoes and cabbages. 

She would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, Irish potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma used her previous loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her tailoring business. With her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Norma is requesting another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed to sew curtains and school and military uniforms. Her regular customers are the local public schools and the police in her town. Her income from her sewing helps greatly in her family's daily sustenance. 

Norma hopes to grow and maintain her sewing and for a happy and healthy life with her husband.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchae fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Joshua is a 54-year-old, proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Joshua has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Joshua described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joshua’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mpoma Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Scolah. She is the administrator of Mpoma Girls Secondary School, a girl’s school in the peri-urban area of Mukono with 650 students. 

Mpoma Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mpoma Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Scolah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya is 35 years old and a married mother of three children who are all dependent children; two of them are in school, while the other one is too young to go to school. She lives in the Sangke district of Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income have come from rice farming and feeding cows for 12 years. She could earn around 30,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

Ya’s group consists of two members, and this is the seventh loan for her, while it is the first for the other one. The previous loans helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading the group of two to apply for this loan. With her portion, she will buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes that she has enough ability to expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, desde pequeño se dedico a trabajar para ayudar en los ingresos de su hogar, no estudio por dedicarse a trabajar junto a su padre, quien se dedico a la agricultura.- Ahora, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, a la agricultura y a construir casas.- Javier, vendió todo el ganado que tenia, para mejorar su vivienda y darle a su familia una vivienda mejor, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando. 

El dinero lo utilizará para comprar ganado, para seguir trabajando por que tuvo que venderlo todo para construir su casa.

Javier, sueña con comprar más ganado, para seguir trabajando por que esa es su pasión, de esa manera espera generar ingresos para su esposa y para que sus hijos no les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Javier has been working to help with the income of the house since he was small. He didn't study as he had to work together with his father, who was a farmer. Now he works raising cattle, farming and building houses. Javier sold all the cattle he had to improve his house and give his family a better place to live. He has 3 children who are studying.

He will use the money to buy cattle to continue his work as he had to sell all his cattle to construct his house. Javier dreams of buying more cattle and continue working as this is his passion. In this way he hopes to generate more income for his wife and so that his children have all they need.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
Munyekelwa (shown first on the left) is from Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She is 27 years old, married and supports 10 people in her family, including her seven children. 

She has been selling salt fish since 2000, and this job is her only source of income. Munyekelwa has reached out to the Wezesha Project in order to increase her capital. She stocks up at a large market and resells at her local market. Before her business was very challenging, but now everything is going well due to the loans. The loans from the Wezesha Project have really given her a boost, and this will be her seventh from the program. 

In the future, she would like to obtain a larger loan so that she can expand her sales volume, making more profit that will help to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz Estella es una madre soltera cabeza de familia, tiene 3 hijos que depende en la totalidad de ella, dos de ellos adolescentes en estudio y buscando un trabajo de medio tiempo para apoyar a su madre, Estella se dedica a la venta de dulces, papas en bolsa, chocolates, vende helados y también realiza recargas telefónicas, de luz (para los hogares) y adicionalmente vende lotería.

El negocio lo inicio en el año 2013 como necesidad económica para solventar las dificultades económicas que tenía y poco a poco fue saliendo progresando y ahora que se encuentra estable busca un apoyo para no solo producir lo suficiente para comer y pagar los servicios públicos (luz, agua, gas, saneamiento), busca esta ayuda para poder mejorar, salir de la pobreza, quitarle la idea a su hijos de trabajar, para que se concentre en sus estudios, pues es una madre muy noble y preocupada.

Solicita un préstamo para poder arreglar el enfriador, este lo necesita de urgencia dado que tiene el negocio de los helados parados por este inconveniente, comprar surtido de sabores de helados, papas en bolsa y dulces.
texts.en:
Luz Estella is a single mother who is the head of the family. She has three children who depend on her completely. Two of them are adolescents in school and are seeking half-time work in order to help their mother. Estella's work is selling sweets, potato chips, chocolates, and ice cream. She also does mobile phone top-ups, [collects] electricity [payments] for homes, and sells lottery tickets.

She began the business in the year 2013 as an economic necessity to resolve the economic difficulties that she was having, and little by little it progressed,. Now that she finds herself stable, she is looking for support not only to produce enough to eat and pay for the public services (electricity, water, gas, and sewer), she is seeking this help to be able to improve, to get out of poverty, and to dissuade her children of the idea that they have to work, so that they can concentrate on their studies, since she is a very generous and worried mother.

She is applying for a loan to be able to repair her freezer. She needs this urgently, given that she has stopped the ice cream business because of this inconvenience. She will also buy a stock of various flavors of ice cream, potato chips, and sweets.

loans.use: to make urgent repairs on her freezer and to buy various flavors of ice cream and a stock of supplies.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
Al hablar de Anderson no se puede evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Anderson no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como jornalero decidió iniciar con un negocio de cultivo y producción de maíz en el municipio de Puerto Salgar.
Es por esta razón que Anderson solicita un crédito para la compra insumos como pesticidas, semillas de maíz, abonos, para mejorar sus tierras, realizar un mantenimiento adecuado y tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su sueño es que pueda mejorar las condiciones físicas de su pequeña vivienda.
texts.en: Talking with Anderson you can't help notice that he is a farmer from birth. Born and raised with the beautiful values of the country such as humility and hard-work, these being the two most representative of the farmers of Colombia. He was not satisfied with his income as day labor so he decided to start a business growing and producing corn in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. For this reason Anderson is requesting a loan to buy inputs like pesticide, corn seed and manure to improve his land, to do an adequate maintenance and have a better quality product. His dream is to improve the physical conditions of his small house.

loans.use: to buy inputs like pesticides, corn seed and manure to improve his land.

loans.name: Yonn's Group

texts.en:
Yonn is a resident in a rural area located in Sangke district of Battambang province. She is 64 years old, married, and has three children. For the past 12 years, the sources of her family’s income have been rice farming and feeding cows. She earns around 34,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Yonn’s group consists of three members. This is Yonn's fifth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have a better standard of living. As a leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees. She wishes to expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 25 years old, and he lives with his father in the village of Tsovazard of Gegharkunik region. This young man very early became interested in farming, and today he is rather good in that.

Davit's mother died several years ago, and with his father Davit tries to take care of both their house and their farm cutely and properly. On the farm, Davit has cows, heifers, lambs and a pig. The only source of income for this family is the sale of farm products such as milk and meat.

Now his farm cattle have a great lack of fodder. He needs this loan in order to buy a lot of fodder for his farm and also one more piglet to enlarge his farm.

loans.use: to buy one more piglet and a lot of fodder for his farm.

loans.name: Beg

texts.en:
Beg is a hardworking man. He was born in 1971 in a rural area where there is no technology like access to the Internet and media. Now he is living in a village with his family.

For almost fifteen years, he has had experience of doing business. He is a goal-oriented, responsible and careful person. His children are not adults, and his wife is sick. Their standard of living is very poor. He did a lot in his life, and practiced keeping cattle and planting agricultural crops from his childhood.

He is planning to buy medicines for the treatment of his wife. Beg is hoping to make payments from the gained harvest of his crops. He requests a loan from Kiva lenders to buy medicines for his wife. He hopes she will be safe and healthy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for the treatment of his wife.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.ru: Зоя, 59 лет, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. 20 лет назад она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, благодаря своему упорству и целеустремленности, Зоя достигла хороших результатов, и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: корова, лошадь. На участке мерою 1,50 Га она выращивает картофель для реализации, также продает молоко. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Зоя обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец. На доходы от кредита Зоя планирует и дальше развивать свое хозяйство и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Zoya is 59 years old and married. Her children are now grown up and independent. Twenty years ago Zoya started to work in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to her perseverance and determination, Zoya achieved good results and today she has cows and horses on her farm. On her 1.5 hectare plot she grows potatoes, which she sells along with milk. In order to increase her herd, Zoya turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase two calves and twenty sheep. With the income from this investment Zoya plans to further develop her farm and build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two calves and 20 sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Luis un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 

Como todo buen agricultor Colombiano, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos de café pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos y comprar insumos como abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, entre otros, con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en: Luis is a humble farmer who goes out to work to his fields every morning. He is fully devoted to his work. He only thinks of progressing and delivering a good product, because he knows that many persons consume it. Therefore, he puts all his effort so that his products are pure and of quality. Like every good Colombian farmer, he always wants to implement repairs and improvements for his coffee crops, but he knows that these repairs or implementations are very pricey.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to adapt his fields and to buy inputs such as manure, pesticides, fungicides, among others, with the sole purpose of improving his way of cultivating, to simplify his work and to give a quality product to his final customer.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as manure, pesticides, fungicides, among others, with the purpose of improving his way of cultivation.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a 39-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. With this loan, Simon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase five solar lights. 

Since joining Kiva's partner, One Acre Fund, in 2013, Simon has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Simon described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey is 37 years old and a married mother of four dependent children, who are all in school. She lives in a rural area located in Phnom Proek District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. For the past 14 years, the sources of her family’s income have been rice farming, sesame farming, and selling groceries. She earns around 51,000 KHR per day for her family’s daily needs. This is the first loan through Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for Srey’s group, which consists of two members. She is leading the group to apply for this loan. She will use her portion to rent farmland and buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to rent farmland and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maman Speciale Group

texts.en:
Faida (second from the left) is married and the mother of six children. She is 24 years old and lives in Kiliba, a village in the province of South Kivu in the eastern part of Democratic Republic of Congo.

Faida's group is made up of five women who sell different cereals. They have formed a group in order to benefit from the financial support of the Wezesha Project to successfully run and grow their business.

The group's leader, Faida, is going to purchase more sacks of beans to sell to her customers in the village. She has been in this business for more than five years now, since she was 18.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of them attend school. She is also looking after her cousin and sister. She has a restaurant at the market and has been working for the last 5 years, working six days a week. She also sells raw sweet potatoes and cassava to earn more income. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, dry peas, beans, rice, beef, beans, and flour. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation costs. Her dream is to serve as many customers as possible. She lives in a rented house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, dry peas, beans, rice, beef, and beans.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector runs a water refilling station. He sells purified drinking water in five-gallon containers. Aside from that, he also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various commodities such as noodles, canned goods, and soap. He has been engaged in that kind of business for more than ten years. He is a married man with four grown children from Getafe, Bohol.

He has requested a loan to buy gallon containers, a water tank, and supplies for the store. These are very important materials that are essential for the operation of both of his sources of income. It will enable him to cater to his respective customers’ needs, and these will help augment his earnings. With these, he is hoping that he could properly manage his business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy gallon containers, a water tank, and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Sor Natali

texts.es:
Natali es una joven madre cabeza de familia, tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica a la actividad de confección a terceros, para poder solventar sus necesidades económicas (comida, transporte, estudio de sus hijos, pago de servicios públicos), todo ello lo paga gracias a su actividad de confección a terceros que inicio por necesidad económica y aprendiendo empíricamente, viendo y practicando en su casa.

Natali trabaja 9 horas, todos los días de la semana, descansa cuando no hay tanto volumen de trabajo, pero la idea es entregar productos de calidad y a tiempo para generar confianza entre sus clientes y pensando en entregar siempre sus trabajos a tiempo fue que le surgió la idea de comprar una maquina plana, que le mejorara considerablemente sus tiempos de producción aparte de que podrá contratar una persona para que le ayude, pero como empezó hace poco no cuenta con el capital para comprarla, razón por la cual solicitara un préstamo que quiere invertir en la compra de una maquina plana.
texts.en:
Natali is a young mother who is the head of her household. She is 28 years old, and she makes a living providing tailoring services to third parties in order to cover her economic needs including food, transportation, her children's education, and utility payments. She pays for all of these things through her work providing tailoring services to third parties, which she started due to economic necessity and learned empirically, watching and practicing at home.

Natali works 9 hours per day every day of the week. She rests when her work volume is low. She strives to deliver quality products in a timely manner in order to build her customers' trust. Thinking about always delivering her products on time is what gave her the idea of buying a tabletop sewing machine, which will greatly improve her production time. In addition, she will be able to hire somebody to help her. 

Since she started recently, she does not have the capital to buy a sewing machine. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 29 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Гулжан среднее образование, она с 2003 года в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2корова и лошадь. На 1,0 Га собственной и 0,32 Га арендованной земли выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и постройку сараев.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 29 years old and married with two children. Gulzhan has a high school education and since 2003 has worked in animal husbandry and farming to provide an income for her family. Thanks to her persistent work, Gulzhan now has two cows and a horse on her farm. On her own one hectare plot and a leased 0,32 hectare plot she grows barley. Her monthly income is approximately 17,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Gulzhan turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase hay for her livestock. She plans to invest her income in the further expansion of her business and the construction of barns.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Laichheng's Group

texts.en:
Laichheng is 45 years old and a married mother of three children who are all dependent and in school. She lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are rice farming for one hectare, potato farming for 2 hectares and rubber plants for one hectare. She has been working in her current business for twenty-seven years, and she earns around 50,000KHR per day to support her family.  

Laichheng’s group consists of three members, and this is the third micro loan for her. The previous loans helped her to have a better standard of living. Now she is leading this group to apply for a loan with her portion to buy fertilizer for farming. She hopes that she will earn more income and create a new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Riziki Kiliba Group

texts.en:
Fatuma (first on the right) is a mother of 8 children living in Kiliba Village of Uvira, Eastern of Democratic Republic of Congo. She does everything that she can for her children so that they may eat and dress well. Fatuma is very protective of her children: her dream is to watch them graduate from university. She is working hard to achieve this. 

Fatuma is applying for a loan in order to buy sacks of flour to cook doughnuts, a popular staple in Eastern Congo. This loan will allow Fatuma to increase the volume of doughnuts she can cook and sell on the roadside. She hopes that she will earn a good profit and work towards the goal of sending her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase  sacks of flour.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en:
Vat lives in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of the Kampong Cham province. She is 50 years old and a married mother of six children: four of them are dependent, and one is in school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming, which they have been doing for thirty years. To earn more income, she also works as a construction worker. She earns around 60,000KHR per day to support her family’s daily needs.

This is the second loan for Vat’s group which consists of two members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have a better living condition and have a good-looking house to live in. As a leader, she applies for this loan with her portion to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is 50 years old and he lives with his brother and mother in Kapan city of the Syunik region. He is not married. Kamo has a higher education and the specialty of engineer-mechanic. Kamo has had his own small woodworking workshop in the yard of his house for many years; here he takes orders from bee keepers to make boxes for bees, frames, etc. 

He also manages agricultural activities: on his plot of land he cultivates potatoes and greens and then sells most of it with the help of his brother. Now Kamo has a new idea and he needs financial support. He asks for this loan to construct a greenhouse: with the loan he will buy metal frames and plastic covers for it, and also he will buy wood for his woodworking workshop.

loans.use: to buy metal frames and plastic covers for a greenhouse, and wood for his woodworking workshop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has two children who are four and six years old. She describes herself as honest and innovative. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

Rose will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer, animal feed, and seeds. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create a sustainable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, animal feed, and seeds

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman and has two kids who attend school.  She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Esha has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents, and she dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 25,000 Kes., she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Fredy Fernando

texts.es:
Fredy campesino de 32 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee café, cultivos que atiende todos los días, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Fredy, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca en mejores condiciones, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is a hard-working, humble, 32-year-old farmer. As a child, he learned to perform all kinds of field work thanks to the teachings of his parents. This has allowed him to succeed. Today, he has his own coffee crops, which he takes care of every day. In addition, he works as a day laborer at different farms in the region in order to supplement his income, with which he fights for the well-being of his parents who fought so hard to move him forward.

With the help of the loan that he is requesting from the institution Interactuar, he will buy agricultural supplies at wholesale such as compost, pesticide, fertilizer, and others. This way, he will continue taking care of his crops, and he will produce a better yield. Additionally, he will be more productive, improving his income by selling his products. 

Fredy, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength, and determination, wishes to continue fighting to fulfill his dream of having a farm in better condition, where he can cultivate a greater variety of products in order to improve the profitability of his business, ensuring that his family has economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale such as compost, pesticide, fertilizer, and others.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Comprar vivienda e incrementar su utilidad son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente y arduamente a Álvaro, quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras ha logrado ser útil y salir adelante con gran empuje y emprendimiento.

Álvaro buscando ser más competitivo, más prospero frente a la competencia, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para reconstruir un galpón y comprar gallinas ponedoras, así podrá tener una producción de huevos más alta y ser un distribuidor a considerar en el mercado municipal.
texts.en: To buy a house and to increase his profits are his goals that motivate Álvaro to get up and work hard. With his business raising laying chickens he has manged to be useful and get ahead with great drive and undertaking with his business of raising egg laying chickens.  Álvaro is looking to be more competitive and more prosperous against his competition, last in the market, improve his sales and his existence on his farm.  He wants to request a loan to construct a shed and buy egg laying chickens. Then he will have a greater production of eggs and be a distributor to consider in the municipal market.

loans.use: to construct a shed and buy egg laying chickens.

loans.name: Muhira

texts.en:
Muhira is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is married and has four children. She is living in a rural area where the majority of people are poor. 

Muhira has ten years of practice doing business. She is a kind, goal-oriented woman who loves to work hard. Her family's standard of living is very bad. She is busy in agriculture and plants potatoes and wheat. 

Her house is close to mountains and in order to keep her family safe from dangers, like earthquakes and wild animals, she needs to have a safe house. 

Muhira is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies, like cement, bricks, and sand. She believes that if she can renovate her house, her family would be safer and would live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies, like cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie earns a living by toiling on the land and growing vegetables. She sells vegetables like ampalaya (bitter gourd). She is married and has five dependents. Her oldest child is sixteen and the youngest is six. Aside from vegetable farming, she engages in a buy and sell business to augment her income. She buys and at the same time sells mangoes to the locals in her area. Together with her family, she resides in Talibon, Bohol.

Margie is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer and additional capital for buying and selling. With these inputs, she would be able to continue her buy and sell business, and she could expand the farm and be able to increase the yield of her farm. Thus, she could provide her children with good food and better living conditions.

She is hoping that someday she will own a farm for a sustainable livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer and to have additional capital for buying and selling

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

Nancy will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets and other raw materials for making jikos (metal stoves) and metallic boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of motor-vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jairo es un hombre enérgico trabajar, ese hombre que te saca una sonrisa con alguna ocurrencia o dicho gracioso, es un hombre que vive junto con su pareja y tiene 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos menores de edad.

Se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas como lo son hamburguesas, perros calientes, papas a la francesa, arepas rellenas, chorizos carne asada de res, cerdo, pollo entre otros.

Jairo apoya a sus hijos en estudio y trabajo, ellos le ayudan a sostener su negocio, y con lo que les paga pueden mantener sus estudios, siendo su sueño verlos graduarse y ocupar un importante cargo en alguna empresa.

Jairo solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en la compra de un congelador, y materia prima (panes, carne, ensalada, servilletas, empaques, cubiertos y platos desechables, empaques y bolsas).
texts.en:
Jairo is an energetic man, that man who gets a smile out of you with any wisecrack or funny saying. He lives with his partner and has 4 children, two of whom are adults and two of whom are children.

He makes his living selling fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, fries, stuffed arepas, sausage, grilled steak, pork, chicken, and more.

Jairo supports his children with their education and work; they help him run his business, and with the money he pays them they can keep up their studies. It is his dream to see them graduate and hold an important position in a company.

Jairo is requesting a loan that he wants to use to buy a freezer and supplies (bread, meat, salad, napkins, disposable cutlery and plates, containers, and bags).

loans.use: to buy a freezer, bread, meat, salad, napkins, containers, and cutlery.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 50 years old and she lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. Armine is married and has two sons; her elder son is married and lives with his family, and her younger son works in Russian Federation. 

Armine graduated Vanadzopr State Pedagogical Institute from the faculty of methodology and pedagogy. For over 25 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. At her house, she also helps some pupils who have hardships in learning to understand and overcome those hardships. Armine is greatly beloved and respected pedagogue, and she does her best in this sphere. She asks for this loan because she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature, since these all will greatly help her while preparing the program for her private courses at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en: Lyudmila is 37 years old. She is married and has a child who is studying the first course of Technical University. Lyudmila wants her son to be a good engineer and she works hard to give a good education to him. They live in the Fuzuli region, but for 22 years they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Lyudmila has a store and sells daily food products. A while ago her fridge was broken. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). She hopes that this aid helps to develop her business.  She says “Thanks to Kiva organization and friends.”

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock of tailoring materials. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his 10th loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle to expand his business. His business goal is to have a good business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to own a big grocery store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread, milk and other items. He also owns a posho mill. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock . He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of maize to produce maize flour in his posho mill. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loana were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another retail shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize to produce maize flour in his posho mill

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is thankful that she was granted a Php15,000 loan, which she used to buy sacks of rice needed for her wholesale/retail rice business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another Php 15,000 loan to buy several sacks of rice to sell either wholesale or retail price. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines, it constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. Her earnings from selling rice helps cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given her.

Lina hopes to sustain and increase her rice selling business. She aims for her high school child to get a college education and become a professional some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

 All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea and coffee. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are large scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his taxi. His business goal is to expand business within five years.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Oin

texts.en:
Oin is originally from a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 52 years old and a married mother of three independent children. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, potato farming, and working for other farms.

Oin has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and completely repaid the loans. The previous loans helped her to have a better living condition and enough food to eat.

Now, she decided to take this new loan in order to buy seeds, pay for laborers, and hire farmland to do the farming. She hopes that she can earn more money and renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pay for laborers, and hire farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is age 34 years old and a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school.  The other one is too young for school. She lives in a rural area located in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, potato farming and working for another farm. She could earn around 42,000KHR per day for supporting the needs of her family. 

Channa’s group, which consists of two members, has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and completely repaid the loans. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan with the portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get a bigger yield and wants to expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 8 years to 19 years. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as good. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as good. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, eggs, flour and other items. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, eggs, flour and other items

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be active. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, sugar, bread and other items. She also runs Mpesa business. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have multiple shops within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man with two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells building stones and bricks. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are house builders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. He will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for his business. His goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married and has five children. She describes herself as honest. Mary operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more fruit. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Koemsroeun's Group

texts.en:
Koemsroeun lives in a rural area of Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and a married mother of four children.  Two are dependent children, one of whom is in school. The main source of her family’s income is from feeding pigs for sale. To earn more income, she also works as a construction worker. She could earn around 80,000KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

This is the first loan for Koemsroeun’s group, which consists of two members. As a leader, she applies for this loan to buy more small pigs and food for feeding them. She hopes that she can earn more income and have the ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more small pigs and food for feeding

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is 31 years old, and she is a mother of three pretty girls (all of them are school-aged). Hermine’s family is a rather big one. She lives in Getahovit frontier village of Tavush region with her children and parents-in-law. Her husband seasonally goes to Russian Federation and does different construction work there; he transfers money for his family nearly each month.

While in Getahovit, Hermine and her parents-in-law run farming and agriculture. Hermine works at the village food market as a saleswoman, and simultaneously she takes care of her farm and farm cattle. On her farm she has two cows, two beehives and twenty chickens.

Hermine has regular customers among her neighbors and friends in the village who buy milk, cheese, eggs, poultry and honey from her. With the help of her father-in-law, Hermina cultivates potatoes on her plot of land, which she sells to re-sellers from the city. Hermine mentions that she would like her husband to finally come back to his family, and they can together develop their farm.

She asks for this loan, as she wants enlarge her farm with cattle. With this loan, she will buy a bull, several piglets, and also animal fodder for farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a bull, several piglets, and also animal fodder for farm cattle.

loans.name: Franklin Alexander

texts.es: Franklin es un joven de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su madre en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años, además viven con ellos sus dos hermanos mayores. Él siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que desde hace 3 años se dedica a realizar viajes expresos, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante y apoyar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar. Franklin desea ampliar su vivienda, ya que siente que no cuenta con el espacio necesario para vivir en su vivienda, por la cantidad de personas que habitan en la misma, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin is 22 years old and has lived with his mother and 2 older brothers in his own home for the last 15 years.  He always wants to improve his living conditions so he started working in transportation 3 years ago specializing in express trips.  With this he has been able to succeed and support his mother with the home expenses.
Franklin wants to expand his home because he feels they don't have the approrpriate space needed for all the people residing in the home.  This is the reason why he's requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to enlarge his home and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to enlarge his home.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana runs a business engaging in buying and selling scrap materials such as iron, metals, plastic bottles, and broken parts of any appliances. She is a 58-year-old woman with no dependents. Together with her husband, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to purchase more scrap materials to resell. With these, she will be able to buy more and sell at a reasonable price. Thus, she could now continue her livelihood and start to expand. She could handle her finances and be able to set aside some savings for emergency purposes.

She hopes that, despite having no children, she would be able to improve her livelihood and live happily together with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to resell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells bananas. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

He will use the KES 23,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas.

His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused.
