She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to have many boutiques within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man and has two children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a farm where he grows collard greens, tomatoes, and spinach. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be pests. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Wilmar Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Wilmar es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de tienda de abarrotes

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado para la vida.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar el negocio de tienda que le están ofreciendo y en el que ve una gran oportunidad de progreso.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un veterano lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en: Wilmar is a very enterprising and creative man. For some time, he has wanted to become independent and to have his own grocery store business. Currently, he is able to materialize his dream thanks to his work ability and the support he receives from Interactuar and from the people who wish him to move ahead with his business. His wife and children depend on this business, and he wants to teach them about it and leave them this legacy for life. He is requesting financial support to buy a store that has been offered to him, in which he sees an opportunity to progress. With a loan, you will be able to support a veteran who is full of life and motivation for his family!

loans.use: to buy the store business that they are offering him.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer trabajadora, ama de casa, se dedicó casi toda la vida a atender a su esposo, ser una excelente mujer y compañía incondicional de su conyugue.

Yolanda no quería sentirse como una carga, como una persona mantenida y es por ello que decidió trabajar en la venta de alimentos específicamente realizados en queso y pescado, y esto el permitió generar recursos y al tener su local en su residencia pudo seguir atendiendo sus labores domésticas.


Su sueño es poder tener un local propio, ser totalmente independiente financieramente y luchar por comprar un hogar propio.

Solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en su totalidad en compra de queso y pescado con los cuales prepara unos ricos aperitivos y almuerzos buscando sorprender a sus clientes y captar mayor mercado.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard working woman who dedicated her life to taking care of her husband, as an excelent housewife, and incoditional companion to her spouse.  Yolanda didn't want to feel like a burden to anyone or like she had to to be taken care of so she started selling food preparations based on fish and cheese.  This allowed her to generate income and because she has her business in her home she is able to attend her dometics duties.  Her dream is to have her own business space, be totally independent financially, and fight to buy her own home.
She's requesting a loan that she'll completely invest in buying fish and cheese with which to make delicious appetizers and lunches trying to surprise her clients and expand on that clientele.

loans.use: to buy cheese and fish as well as other ingredients for her food sales.

loans.name: Roxana Yamileth

texts.es:
Roxana, de 29 años de edad, estudio Doctorado en Medicina, está soltera y vive con sus padres, ella quiere trabajar para que a sus padres no les falte nada, porque ya son adultos mayores y no pueden trabajar.

Roxana, tiene un año de experiencia, porque hace dos años termino su carrera y coloco su consultorio en la casa donde vive con sus padres, atiende durante todo el día, pero si hay emergencias durante la noche también los atiende, su prioridad es servir.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar la infraestructura del consultorio, para tener un lugar más cómodo para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes y servir a la sociedad a través de su trabajo.- El préstamo mejorará su calidad de vida, porque con la mejora del consultorio, tendrá mucho mas clientes y servirá a más personas.

Roxana, sueña con ampliar más su consultorio y comprar mejore equipo medico, para brindar una mejor atención a sus pacientes.- Además, sueña con ser reconocida por sus servicios y por su ayuda a la población.
texts.en:
Roxana is 29 years old and is a Medical Doctor. She's single and lives with her parents.  She wants to work so that her parents have everything they need since they are older now and cannot work.  
Roxana has one year of experience because she finished her degree two years ago and opened her medical office in her parents home.  She attends patients all day and if there are emergencies at night she also takes care of them.  Her priority is to serve.  
She's requesting the loan to make improvements to the infastructure of her medical office and have a more comfortable space to give her patients a better attention and serve society through her work.  
The loan will improve her quality of life because by improving her office she'll be able to get more clients and serve more people.  Roxana dreams with expanding her office and buying better medical equipment to give a better service to her patients.  Additionally, she wants to be recognized for her services and her help to the neighborhood.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her medical office.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y honesta, está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando.

José, toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar la agricultura, ya que su padre le enseño como hacerlo y a través del tiempo ha tenido muy buenas experiencias, que le han servido para poder ponerlas en practica con su cultivo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una yunta de bueyes, ya que un amigo la esta vendiendo y José no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprarlos, es por eso que solicita la ayuda del crédito.

José, desea seguir trabajando en la agricultura y ayudar sus hijos para que se preparen academicamente y sean unas personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old. He is a hard working and honest person. He is in a relationship, and he has 2 children who are studying.

All his life, Jose has been dedicated to working in agriculture, since his father taught him how to do it. Over time, he has had very good experience, which have helped him to be able to put his father’s lessons into practice with his crop.

The loan is needed to buy a team of oxen. A friend is selling the animals, but Jose does not have enough money to buy them. For this reason, he requests the help of a loan.

Jose wants to continue working in agriculture and to help his children by preparing them academically, so that they will become good people in society.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen.

loans.name: Chahzanan

texts.en: Chahzanan is a 49-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working since 2008 at her house selling homemade foods to help her husband, who is the main income provider in the family, to be able to meet their needs in life and to improve their lifestyle. Chahzanan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to better her business merchandise in order to give the best products to her clients. She has a good reputation in her hometown for giving the best products to her clients. She said that she is very sure that she will sell all products and expand her area of business. She hopes that in the near future, she might open her own store.

loans.use: to improve the homemade food products she sells.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business, where she sells charcoal, and has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in an area fit for business, and her primary customers are the general public. She says that her biggest business challenge is lack of funds.

This is Elizabeth's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfuly repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 99,500 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man with three children. He describes himself as experienced. He operates a retail business, where he sells bulbs and other electrical goods, and has been involved in this business for seven years.

His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He says that his biggest business challenge is lack of funds.

This is Fredrick's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more bulbs and other electrical goods to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more bulbs and other electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Si's Group

texts.en:
Si is 42 years old and a married mother of two children. They are all dependent children and one of them is in school. She resides in a rural area of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province.

The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on a two-hectare area for 22 years. To better support her family, she earns more income by feeding pigs for sale as well. Having these careers, she earns around 50,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

Si’s group consists of two members, and this is the third loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to have more farmland for doing farming. As a leader, she applies for this loan on the basis of using her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and feed for her pigs in order to support her current business. She hopes that she will be able to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes, and has been involved in this business for seven years.

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is lack of funds.

This is Monicah's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 12, 16 y 8 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 5 años, lo que le permite apoyar a la economía de su hogar, además buscando obtener mejores ingresos vende platillos típicos por las tardes. María poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda apoyándose en créditos ya que no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito el cual le permita seguir mejorando el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para mejorar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible ya que se acerca el invierno y teme que sus pocas pertenencias continúen deteriorándose a causa de la lluvia.
texts.en: María, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children, ages 12, 16 and 8, who are students. She is a very hard-working woman who has offered her domestic services for the past 5 years, which allows her to support the household economy. In addition, looking to get more income, she sells typical dishes in the afternoon. María, little by little, has been improving her house, supporting herself in our institution, so she again asks for a loan which will allow her to continue improving the roof on her house and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to improve the roof on her house as soon as possible since winter is approaching and she fears that her few belongings will continue to deteriorate due to the rain.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to improve the roof on her house.

loans.name: Ixquimane Group

texts.en:
There are eight visionary women who actively participate in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Ixquimane” in the Western Highland town of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. The ladies help and encourage each other to be leaders in their community as well as in their homes. They share the responsibility of bringing income into their families along with their husbands. Their common goals are to bring a higher quality of life to their children and to be positive examples to other women in their community.

The ladies have various businesses including animal husbandry (chickens and pigs), and traditional textile production (“blusas” or ornate lightweight blouses, “huipiles” or heavier woven/embroidered blouses, “boinas” or berets, and hats). As there are numerous orchards in the area, other women have businesses growing and selling fruit such as apples, passion fruit, lemons, peaches and plums.

Tomasa is the Secretary of the Trust Bank as she is the only one who knows how to read and write. She was able to attend primary school until the 4th grade. Tomasa is the mother of one son. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of various colors of thread and other supplies for her traditional textile business. Tomasa sells her huipiles, berets and hats in the large and colorful market in Chichicastenango. She also wants to use part of the loan to purchase two pigs to fatten up and sell.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your generosity in funding the loans for these women.  They are already taking steps toward a brighter and more prosperous tomorrow for themselves, their families, and their community.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of various colors of thread and other supplies for her traditional textile business

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis de 28 años de edad es soltero y brinda servicios de electricista ya que estudió la carrera de electricidad industrial en un instituto particular concluyéndola satisfactoriamente. Debido a la gran demanda que él tiene por sus servicios y crecer profesionalmente convalido su carrera en la Universidad del Callao, ahora va por el 5to ciclo de la carrera de ingeniería. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una computadora ya que le hace mucha falta por los trabajos que le demandan y también muebles de estudio. Una de las metas que tiene Luis es implementar su propia empresa que ofrezca servicios profesionales y así dar trabajo a muchos jóvenes emprendedores como él. Luis se siente muy agradecido y contento por el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los señores de KIVA y desea que la ayuda continúe.
texts.en:
Luis, 28, is single.  He offers electrician services, having studied in a private institute and satisfactorily completed the industrial electrician program.  There's great demand for his services and he wants to grow professionally, so he strengthened his coursework at the Universidad de Callao.  Currently he's in his fifth semester of the engineering program.

He's going to use the loan to buy a computer, which he needs for the many papers he's required to write, as well furniture for his study.

Luis said one of his goals is to start his own business offering professional services so he can create work for other young entrepreneurs like himself.  He also made it known that he's very grateful for and happy about the support he's getting from Kiva, and he hopes the help continues.

loans.use: to buy a computer and furniture for his study

loans.name: Edairo

texts.es:
Edairo, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Momil, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Edairo solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 5 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto.

Siempre lleva presente que el camino al éxito está en el trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Edairo is a farmer full of dreams and life aspirations who wants to move his family forwards by the sweat of his brow.  

For this reason, he started a business raising pigs.  This is a common profession in the town of Momil, a place that stands out not only for the price but also the quality of the pigs that are raised there.  

Edairo is applying for a loan to buy pigs that he will fatten for their subsequent sale, towards the aim of progressing and taking care of his family who raise his spirit to fight and thrive.  

He works very hard every day for 5 hours on various activities, and he is a go-getter and restless man.  He always keeps in mind that the road to success comes from constant work.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell later

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Paola es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.

Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja sola durante 8 horas todos los días.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de una fritadora industrial, un carro de comidas, insumos y materia prima, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Paola's perseverance and courage, her household can now lead a dignified life. She prepares and sells fast food in the city of Medellín, work she began with the goal of finding a new source of income to support her family. Her husband and children are her greatest motivation for working hard and striving to make each day better. She works by herself for eight hours everyday. 

She wants to drive her business forward with the purchase of an industrial fryer, a food cart, supplies, and ingredients. Interactuar and the Kiva lenders can be the ones who give her this push. 

With these things, she can make her food available to her customers at any time. Her end goal is to run a restaurant in the same area so that she doesn't lose her customers.

loans.use: buy an industrial fryer, a food cart, supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora, Bernarda de 47 años de edad, tiene casa propia  y ella radica en la comunidad de El Guayabo # 1 Se dedica desde hace 15 años a su pulpería sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos. La  señora  Bernarda  es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  PRISMA y KIVA por la oportunidad que le está brindando ella ha trabajado con otros bancos anteriormente y desea que Prisma y Kiva le apoyen en el crédito.
Bernarda esta solicitando el préstamo para compra ABARROTERIA como frijoles, carne, arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higienico, pan, café y otros productos de consumo básico. 
Bernarda con el apoyo del crédito ella pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y su vivienda ella Solicita 10,000 lempiras para compra de productos para la venta, y con el apoyo de este préstamo espera invertirlo y mejorar más sus ingresos.
Bernarda su sueño es que en su próximo crédito  mejorar mas su negocio y su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Marzo del 2015.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a 47 year old woman who has her own home, which is in the community of El Guayabo #1. She has made a living for 15 years in her store, and her customers are all friends and neighbors. Bernarda is a very hardworking woman with many desires to succeed, and she is thankful to Prisma and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing her. She has worked with other banks previously and hopes that Prisma and Kiva support her loan.

Bernarda is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as beans, meat, rice, sugar, butter, eggs, oil, toilet paper, bread, coffee, and other basic consumer products.

With the help of the loan Bernarda intends to serve and improve her business and her home. She is requesting 10,000 lempiras for the purchase of products for sale, and with the help of this loan she hopes to invest more and improve her income.

Bernarda's dream is that her next loan better improves her home and her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, meat, rice, sugar, butter, eggs, oil, toilet paper, bread, coffee, and other basic consumer products for her business.

loans.name: Dario De Jesus

texts.es:
Dario de 70 años, es casado y tiene 1 hijo, desde hace 4 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende en compañía de su esposa. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos, bebidas y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Dario, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de él y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Dario is 70 years old, and he is married and has 1 son. He has had a grocery store for 4 years, which he runs with his wife.

Dario's dream is to expand his store which sells items such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, drinks, and other things.

Currently, he only has a small variety of items, and this is detrimental to him since he can't supply his customers with many of the products that they request.

In light of this, Dario decided to request a loan with the intent of organizing himself and his business. He will also buy at wholesale the necessary assortment of products such as grains, sugar, baked products, and dairy products in order to expand his inventory and be able to offer better service to people. For Dario, this would also mean an increase in income to fulfill the basic requirements of any business such as public utilities, taxes, and more. This would also improve the well-being of Dario and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase grains, sugar, baked products, and dairy products in order to expand his inventory for his customers.

loans.name: Lorena Rosa

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 35 años de edad, separada de su pareja, se convirtió en madre cabeza de familia a cargo de dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad, juntos en familia tratan de salir adelante, Lorena trabajando y sus hijos procurando ser buenos estudiantes, ella se dedica a atender una salsamentaría, dónde ofrece bebidas, papas en bolsa, dulces, tiene mesas de billares para el entretenimiento básicamente de los mayores y recrea un espacio muy amigable y para la dispersión de los campesinos quienes salen de una jornada dura en el campo a tomarse una cerveza y jugar un partida de billar, paralelamente también tiene una cría de cerdos la cual le ayudan sus hijos a mantener con el aseo, dándole alimentos a los cerdos, etc.
Sus sueños son poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener una sostenibilidad de negocio pues este lo empezó en el año 2014, mejoras locativas y de vivienda y bueno seguirá trabajando por tratar de cumplir estos objetivos    auto-impuestos.
Solicita un préstamo para iniciar a cumplir uno de ellos, lo invertirá en algunas mejoras locativas, pues su negocio lo cogió muy decaído y necesita reparaciones, comprar madera, concreto y el resto de capital lo quiere invertir en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Lorena is 35 years old. She is separated from her husband and is now the head of her family, which includes her two children ages 14 and 7. Together this family tries to get ahead: Lorena by working and her children by being good students. Lorena makes a living running a deli, where she offers drinks, potato chips, and sweets. There is also a pool table for the basic entertainment and recreation of adults. It is a very nice space that laborers who work during the day in the fields like to come to have a beer and play pool. At the same time, she also raises pigs. Her children help her to take care of the cleaning and feeding, etc. 

Lorena's dreams are to be able to pay for her children's education, sustain her business (that she opened in 2014), and do some renovations for her business. She will continue working to try to complete these self-imposed objectives. Lorena is requesting this loan in order to start to accomplish one of them. She will invest in renovating the deli's building that is in great need of reparations. She will buy wood and concrete and invest the rest of this capital to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy wood and concrete and invest the rest of this capital to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kilon Tercero

texts.es:
Kilon es una persona casada, padre de dos hijos uno de 13 y otra de 8, se dedica a la comercialización de pulpa de frutas, sus principales compradores son los supermercados, tiendas y restaurantes puesto que son productos naturales y casi listos para preparar el jugo. 
Kilon trabaja directamente realizando las pulpas pero tiene un vendedor encargado de distribuirlas y promocionarlas.
Kilon busca ahora aumentar su inventario y los sabores de su pulpa, ha tratado de hacer pruebas a ver que tanto se vende y en base a las pruebas quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mango, guanábanas, piña, su idea es iniciar a comercializar estos sabores y abrir más mercados.
Con este crédito espera obtener mayores ventas, clientes y utilidades que le permitan seguir aumentando la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Kilon is married and has two children (ages 13 and 8). He works selling fruit pulp to supermarkets, convenience stores and restaurants. His products are natural and almost ready for making juice. 

Kilon makes the pulp and has a salesperson who distributes and advertises it. 

Kilon is looking to increase his inventory of pulp flavors. He has made some tests to see how well different flavors sell. He is requesting a loan to buy mangoes, soursops and pineapples. His idea is to promote these flavours and open new markets. He hopes this loan will allow him to increase his sales, clients and profits, which would improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell mango, soursop and pineapple pulp.

loans.name: Yorladys

texts.es:
Yorladys es una mujer aventura, luchadora, emprendedora, gracias a su negocio de tienda general logra generar el sustento para su familia, para sus padres y ayuda a sus hermanos en momentos complicados, ella nació bajo el seno de una familia humilde y su compromiso es sacarlos adelante y mejorar drásticamente su calidad de vida.
Ella se desempeña como vendedora de productos de la canasta familiar pero no ha podido impulsar de mejor manera su negocio, debido a la falta de capital.
Esta mujer trabaja 9 horas por semana y ahora tiene una idea para impulsar y atraer un mayor número de clientes, como saben que sus vecinos van a la tienda más completa para comprar todo en un mismo lugar, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de carnes, abarrotes, y granos. 
Con este préstamo espera captar la atención de los usuarios y solo como compromiso trabajar arduamente por sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Yorladys is an adventurous, determined, enterprising woman. Thanks to her general store business, she has managed to generate the sustenance for her family, for her parents, and to help her siblings in difficult moments. She was born into a humble family and her commitment is to get them ahead and drastically improve their quality of life. 

She works selling basic pantry items but she has not been able to boost her business in a better way, due to the lack of capital. 

This woman works 9 hours per week and now has an idea to boost and attract a larger number of customers, who know that her neighbors go to the more complete store to purchase everything in the same place. She wants to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment of meat, vegetables, and grains. 

With this loan, she hopes to catch the users' attention and with just commitment to work hard to get the family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase meat, groceries, grains, with the idea of having a complete store where her customers can find everything they need.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 52 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos cuales van a la escuela, en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a trabajar a él en los cultivos.

Isabel, se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol, de la comercialización de sus granos ha logrado, darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos, no fue a la escuela, debido a que sus padres no tenían condiciones para poder apoyarle, él es veterano de la guerra que hubo en El Salvador, pero la ayuda que el gobierno le da es muy poco para cubrir los gastos de él y su familia.

El dinero lo necesita para pagar jornaleros le que le ayuden a sembrar árboles de café, porque una cooperativa de cafetaleros, les venderá los árboles de café ya preparados y él no tiene dinero disponible para poder comprarlos, pero con la ayuda del crédito podrá hacerlo.

El sueña con recuperar su finca, ya que una enfermedad llamada (roya) dañó sus cultivos y ha disminuido la cosecha.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 52, is in a relationship.  He has three children, and two of them go to school.  In their free time they help him work with the crops.  Isabel grows coffee, corn, and beans.  By selling these products he has managed to give his children everything they need.  He did not go to school because his parents were not in a position to be able to help him.  He is a veteran of the war that was in El Salvador.  However, the help that the government gives him is too little to cover his expenses and those of his family.

He needs the money to pay the day workers who help him plant the coffee trees.  A cooperative of coffee dealers will sell him the coffee trees already prepared, and he does not have the money available to be able to buy them.  With the help of the loan he will be able to do so.

He dreams of recovering his farm because a disease called ‘roya’ damaged his crops and the harvest has decreased.

loans.use: to pay the day workers who help him plant coffee trees.

loans.name: Wa Mama Utukufu Group

texts.en:
This group, Wa Mama Utukufu Group, has five borrower members. They are from the city of Uvira in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Jeannette is from this group, and in the photo she is the first from right. She is 40 years old and married with 10 children.

Jeannette has been selling fish for 15 years now. She applied for a loan of $150 to increase her capital so that she can purchase more fish to sell. She is thankful for the financial assistance in the form of loans, which have enabled her to pay the rent and to pay school fees for her children while still strengthening her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Noelie

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Noelie est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Noelie habite à Ségbé et cherche vigoureusement à améliorer leur condition de vie en confectionnant des habits qu’elle vend à ses clients. Noelie s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché afin de trouver une bonne rentabilité de pagnes. Noelie demande ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes  bonnes qualités répondant aux goûts de ses clients et augmenter son profit afin de contribuer favorablement aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Noelie is 28 years old, and is a married woman with four children to care for. She lives in Ségbé and is actively looking to increase her living conditions by making clothes that she sells to her clients. Noelie gets her supply twice per month at the market, in order to have good profitability of pagne [traditional West African fabric].

Noelie is requesting this loan in order to buy pieces of pagne of good quality to appeal to the taste of her clients, and therefore increase her income. By doing this, she will be able to make great contributions to the caring of her children.

loans.use: to buy six pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 1° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 12 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Kelly quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es manicurista, hace a domicilio su trabajo y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Se la conoce por ser una persona jovial, que siempre atiende muy bien a los demás.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, acetonas, alicates, limas y otros, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas Group is in its first loan cycle in the women's bank program, in which they all work and help each other get ahead.  They're doing the poverty elimination survey, in which 12 members are below the poverty line; in other words, they're living in extreme poverty.

Kelly is one of the members.  The work she does includes providing home service as a manicurist, and she has very good customers now.  She's known as a cheerful person who always treats others well.

Kelly's requesting this loan to buy nail polish and remover, clippers, nail files, and other supplies that will help her keep working as she has been doing.

They're all grateful for this opportunity to be able to keep growing and improving every day.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and remover, clippers, nail files, and other supplies

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Jose Obrero está en su octavo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 de las 16 señoras se encuentran en una pobreza extrema, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la costura, ella trabaja con la fundación desde el año  2012, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, creativa y capaz. Por medio del trabajo que hace ayuda a su familia,  y tiene los medios para poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por crecer cada dia.
texts.en:
This group is named “San Jose Obrero” and is in its eighth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are committed to working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that 5 of the 16 women are in extreme poverty, so they are striving to improve their living conditions each day.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who works as a seamstress. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2012. Maria is known for being an enterprising, creative, and capable woman. Through her work, she is able to help her family and have the means to improve.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other supplies so that she can continue her work just as before. She strives to grow each day.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luz Heriberto

texts.es: Luz de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y su hijo de 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace muchos años, por lo que gracias a su amplia experiencia y a su amabilidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre solicitan sus servicios, contando con una gran cantidad de clientes. Luz desea construir  su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir su vivienda, ya que la que tiene actualmente es de lámina deteriorada
texts.en:
Luz, age 35, lives in his own house with his life partner and his 15 year old son.  He is a hard-working man who has been a bricklayer for many years.  Thanks to his vast experience and his affability, he has a great number of customers who always request his services.  He has a lot of customers.

Luz wishes to build his house.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build his house.  The one that he now has is made from metal sheeting that is damaged.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build his house.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: René de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de radio técnico desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas repuestos, herramientas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: René, 38 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has had an electronics repair shop for the past 5 years. He has many customers for his good work. With what he gets from his earnings, he manages to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase more spare parts, tools, etc. to continue with his work and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and brick to rebuild the toilet in his home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business, where she sells flour, sugar, rice and other items, and has been involved in this business for 20 years.

Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She says that her biggest business challenge is low stock. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, rice and other items to restock her store.

This is Mary's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, rice and other items to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a beauty salon and has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are ladies. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds.

This is Jane's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy a hair dryer and other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and other beauty products

loans.name: Kenia Esperanza

texts.es:
Kenia de 39 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian en 6to grado y 3er año de secundaria respectivamente, se  caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal,  en la actualidad luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar  por falta de recursos económicos, los cual no quiere que le pase a sus hijos, para ella poder brindarles estudios a sus hijos es uno de sus objetivos y metas.
Gracias a sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta  de mercadería en general como: pantalones, camisetas sport, faldas, blusas, ropa de interior, ropa de cama, pantalones jens y pantalón de vestir short. Etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en mercadería y aprovechar las buenas ventas Kenia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Kenia is 39 years old. She is originally from Managua. She is married and has two children who are in 6th grade and third year of high school, respectively. Kenia is known for being hardworking, responsible, with great wishes to progress. Currently, she struggles day by day to make her children move ahead. Unfortunately, she was not able to go to school due to a lack of financial resources. She does not want this to happen to her children; therefore, one of her objectives and goals is to give them an education. Thanks to her desire to prosper, she has a job selling general merchandise such as pants, casual t-shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear, bedsheets, jeans, dressy short pants, etc.  She works twelve hours a day offering her products so that in a near future she can have more income. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to take advantage of the good sales. Kenia is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as: pants, casual t-shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear, bedsheets, jeans, dressy short pants, etc.

loans.name: Tuychiboi

texts.en: Tuychiboi is a hospitable man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. He lives in a rural area with a beautiful landscape around him. He is married and has four children. He has 20 years of practice working in agriculture. As his family is big, he needs to work hard to earn money to feed them. The standard of living is very poor and bad. He learned to work in agriculture in his childhood and likes to do business in agriculture. He plants potatoes and wheat, and keeps livestock. Tuychiboi is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy corn and fertilizers. He waits that his next harvest will be good and will help them to live better, as he needs to gain more harvest in order to earn money and feed his family.

loans.use: To buy corn and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge y nieta en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta comunidad esta habitada por gente respetuosa y amable dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas como almuerzos, cenas para fiestas, cumpleaños, matrimonios, etc, desde hace 15 años aproximadamente, por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de nuevos materiales de cocina como ollas, platos, baldes, entre otros, para implementar su negocio, con esto Maria espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and is married. She lives in her family home with her spouse and granddaughter in a community located in the district of Zaña, in the province Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. This community is inhabited by friendly and helpful people who make a living in agriculture and livestock.

She makes a living in the preparation of foods such as lunch, dinner for parties, birthdays, weddings, etc., for about 15 years, so she has experience in this business and has good personal and work references in her district. In addition she works in the raising and selling of small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others. She will use the loan to buy new kitchen materials such as pots, plates, and buckets, among others, to implement in her business. With this Maria hopes to offer a better service to her customers which will generate more income and permit her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen materials such as pots, plates, and buckets, among others, to implement in her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a Kiva borrower. He has one child and describes himself as reliable. He operates a carpentry business and has been involved in this business for 20 years.

His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are locals. His business goal is to have a large-scale carpentry shop within five years. He says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds.

This is Philip's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more carpentry materials for his inventory.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials for his inventory

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Tiene una amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que cuenta con más de 10 años en este negocio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad de cosméticos, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella espera incrementar su stock para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida, 48, is in a common law marriage. She has one son and lives with her family in the Oyotún district. 

This is a rural area located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She sells cosmetics. Her business is located in her home. She has ample experience in this field and has more that 10 years running her business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to increase her stock. This investment will allow her to have more variety of products allowing her to increase her business. 

She hopes to increase her stock of cosmetics in order to serve the different tastes and needs of her clients in the areas that generate the most income for her. 

They allow her to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to increase her stock

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is grateful that she accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to pay and buy more used scrap and recyclable materials to sell at foundries, partly to pay for her business permit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for continually supporting her business.

Rosalie hopes to sustain and expand her business. She prays for a quiet and victorious family. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  to buy scrap like scrap cloth, scrap metals and fragments to sell.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en: Mushegh is 28 years old and he lives with his father in the village Ddmashen of the Gegharkunik region. This young man greatly enjoys his farming activities, which his father taught him from his very young age. In his farm Mushegh has cows, bulls, pigs, sheep and chickens. Since now both Mushegh and his father are unemployed, they take care of their farm properly and manage to sell their farm products (milk, meat and eggs) very profitably. Very often Mushegh also takes orders of meat from the city butchers, which is a great chance of having good sales and significant income for the month. Land cultivation is also part of his every day work on his farm. He cultivates potatoes, beans and greens also for sale. This loan is really very important for his agricultural activities as he hurries to start his spring sowing work, and he needs potato seedlings and fertilizer in order to start the sowing of the season.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna was born in the frontier village of Achajur in the Tavush region, and to this day she still lives here with her big family. She is married and has two daughters and a son.

Ruzanna’s husband has a car, and he provides taxi services in their village. Her parents-in-law are pensioners but are healthy and active despite their age. They greatly help Ruzanna and her husband with the farming and agricultural work.

On the farm, Ruzanna has cows, a bull, a calf, piglets and chickens. Their plot of land yields harvests of potato, carrot, cucumber and tomato and some fruits such as apple, apricot, nuts and fig. Ruzanna sells half of the produce from her house, and the other part goes for family use.

Having a cute but tiny farm for such a big family, Ruzanna’s family has a lot of financial hardships in their everyday life. The sale of their farm products, including milk, meat and eggs, brings such little income that Ruzanna and her husband are very motivated to enlarge their farm.

Ruzanna wants to use this loan of 400,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to purchase several piglets to develop swine breeding, and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several piglets to develop swine breeding, and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one more calf to expand his farm, and to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Asha dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
Luisa es conocida por ser una mujer emprendedora con manos trabajadas que la han llevado a convertirse en una excelente vendedora de ropa y comida durante los últimos años. Ella expresa lo bien que ha crecido y lo importante que es para esta madre soltera de 57 años de edad, invertir en su negocio. Ella se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le ayudaron en el préstamo anterior, con el cual pudo comprar ropa, cosméticos y por supuesto, la comida para cocinar y vender con excelente calidad.
Ahora esta comerciante que tiene más de 28 años de trabajar quiere seguir innovando en su negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar camisas, pantalones, arroz, pollo crudo, frijoles y verduras para seguir elaborando esas deliciosas comidas que la han hecho famosa. Este crédito le ayudará a tener variedad en su negocio y podrá seguir viéndolo crecer.  En sus planes está seguir innovando para poder mejorar su hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa is well known as a resourceful and hard-working woman, who, in the last few years, has managed to become an excellent clothing and food seller. She expresses how she has thrived, and how important this is for a single, 57 year old mother, to be able to invest in her business. 

She is very grateful to all those who helped her with her previous loan, with which she was able to buy clothing, cosmetics and of course, the food to cook and sell to such an excellent standard.

She is now a merchant with more than 28 years experience who wishes to keep investing in her business. This is why she is requesting a new loan to buy shirts and trousers, as well as rice, chicken, beans and vegetables to continue creating her delicious meals for which she has become famous. 

This loan will help her to add variety to her business and to allow her to continue to watch it grow. 

Also among her plans is to keep innovating to be able to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy shirts and trousers, as well as rice, chicken, beans and vegetables

loans.name: Nolba Rosa

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Nolba montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con hija de 15 años. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Nolba ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Nolba busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra tela al por mayor

Nolba espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Nolba espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Nolba set up a clothing shop to generate income to support household expenses. She lives with a 15 year old daughter.

She learned the job by taking some courses. This has allowed her to carry out the work that is characterized as good quality and for timely delivery.

With her work, Nolba gained a large number of customers which has assured her very good monthly sales. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will eventually be able to create employment for those in need.

In order to respond to the customer demand, Nolba is requesting a loan that would provide her access to the fabric wholesale purchase. With this, Nolba hopes that her family would be able to enjoy a better income which would allow them to have a better quality of life and a better quality education. In addition, Nolba hopes for her business to continue to grow at a good pace and that her shop to create at least a job for a person who is in need but does not have the job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Gustavo Anotonio

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su moto-taxi a través de las veredas del municipio de Cañas Gordas posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto-taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Gustavo con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Gustavo is a hard-working and organized man. He earns his living providing transport services for people on his motorcycle taxi through the streets of Cañas Gordas municipality making transport possible through the various areas of the municipality. He is a friendly, very enterprising and helpful man. He is single and supports his mother who always ensured that he had the best life possible.

He is requesting a loan to do maintenance and repairs on his motorcycle taxi as it is his only means of work. With this loan he can improve the condition of his motorcycle and continue to provide his services with total security, not putting his life or his customer's at risk. Support Gustavo with a loan today.

loans.use: to do maintenance and repairs on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John, de 47 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.
El se desempeña como vendedor de ropa.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su familia.

Es un hombre emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en: John is 47 years old and has a very clear vision of what he wants in his life. He is determined to get ahead and have a good life. He works selling clothing. He started this activity with the need to find the necessary resources to sustain himself and his family. He is an enterprising and very disciplined man. He is requesting  a loan to buy a large variety of clothing and this way have inventory at hand to sell to his clients. He hopes to be able to progress as an businessman and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of clothing and in this way have inventory available.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, de 47 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, por falta de recursos económicos solo  estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, uno estudia tercer grado y el otro trabaja en la agricultura.

Zoila, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 años y fue su madre quien la motivo a que invirtiera en un  negocio, antes ella únicamente se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar, su negocio lo tiene en su vivienda, en la cual su hijo después de salir de clase le ayuda, dicha labor es realizada todos los días.

Zoila, solicita el crédito para invertir en su tienda y comprar insumos agrícolas para que su hijo haga la milpa, ella está segura que logrará generar más ingresos económicos para su familia.

Su mayor sueño, es incrementar su negocio, así como también hacer su vivienda de bloque y que su hijo siga estudiando para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 47 years old.  She is a hard-working person.  Due to lack of economic resources, she only studied up to the second grade.  She is a single mother who has two children; one is in the third grade and the other works in agriculture.

Zoila has had a small store for 6 years.  It was her mother who had the motive to invest in a business.  Before that she only worked at the household chores.  She has her business in her house.  Her son helps her after his classes.  The business is carried out every day.

Zoila is asking for a loan to invest in her store and to buy agriculture supplies so that her son can cultivate corn.  She is sure that she will succeed in generating more economic income for her family.

Her greatest dream is to expand her business as well as to make a concrete block house and that her son continue studying in order that he have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her store and to buy agriculture supplies so that her son can cultivate corn

loans.name: Jose Simeon

texts.es:
José, de 24 años de edad, está soltero y vive desde hace mucho tiempo separado de sus padres.

José, se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y a ayudar a sus vecinos en trabajos de finca, donde limpia, poda, abona y hace huecos para sembrar árboles de café.- Él se creció trabajando con sus padres, ellos le enseñaron a trabajar, estudio hasta noveno grado.

José, necesita el dinero para comprar el derecho de agua potable, pues por el momento tiene que halarla en cantaros desde la casa de su vecino y le absorbe mucho tiempo.

Su principal sueño es formar una familia y tener una casa digna donde pueda vivir cómodo.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old, single and has lived separate from his parents for a long time.

José makes a living growing corn and beans, and helping his neighbors on their farms, where he cleans, prunes, applies fertilizer and makes space to sow seeds for coffee trees. He grew up working with his parents, and they taught him to work. He studied until the ninth grade.

José needs money to buy the right to drinking water, because at the moment he has to carry jugs of water from his neighbor's house and this takes him a lot of time.

His main dream is to have a family and a decent house where he can live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy the right to drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment and supplies to start her own beauty salon

loans.name: Geminis Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Géminis, es un grupo mixto conformado por 1 hombre y 2 mujeres (Isaac Prickson, Tamara Isolda, Emely Amacio) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son hombres y mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de barbería, venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza por catalogo y pulpería.

Isaac: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un joven amable de 19 años de edad, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación. Casado con un hijo de dos años de edad. Debido a la falta de empleo y con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, poco a poco con gran esfuerzo, desde hace 3 años estableció una barbería en un local que alquila, pagando una mensualidad aproximada de C$2000 (Dos mil córdobas netos). Solicita su primer préstamo para comprar herramientas y utensilios de belleza: Secadora, Shampoo, acondicionador, tijeras, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Géminis” is a mixed group made up of one man and two women (Isaac Prickson, Tamara Isolda, and Emely) with Miskito ethnic roots from Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  They are entrepreneurial men and women who fight day after day to grow their small businesses, which include a barber shop, beauty product and cosmetics catalog sales, and a general store.

Isaac is the coordinator of the solidarity group.  He is a young, friendly nineteen year old with leadership qualities and the desire to succeed.  He is married with one child, who is two years old.  Due to his lack of employment and his goal to move his child forward in life, he gradually and with great effort established a barbershop in a location that he rents, paying approximately C$2000 (two thousand córdobas) monthly.  He is requesting his first loan to purchase beauty supplies and tools, such as a blow-dryer, shampoo, conditioner and scissors, as well as other products.  His dream is to improve the infrastructure of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies and tools, such as a blow-dryer, shampoo, conditioner and scissors, as well as other products

loans.name: Salvaje Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario salvaje, está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Cristina, Katheen Bianka, Delita) todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita y viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo que se organizó hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Cristina vende mariscos de manera ambulante, Katheen Bianka elabora de manera artesanal reposterías y Delita vende bastimentos, frutas y verduras.

Delita: Es integrante del grupo solidario Salvaje, es una mujer amable de 45 años de edad., casada con 4 hijos que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal. Ella desde hace 2 años vende de manera ambulante y en las paradas de buses extiende en el suelo un plástico negro para ofertar sus productos: mariscos, pescados, bastimentos y carbón  que se dedica  a la venta de pescado, bastimento y carbón, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su inventario de verduras, frutas y bastimentos, así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella y su esposo sueñan con tener una pulpería para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The "Salvaje" communal bank is made up of 3 fighting women (Cristina, Katheen Bianka, Delita). They all belong to the Miskito ethnic group and live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. It's a new group that organized 8 months ago with the aim of working together to access loans from Pana Pana and have the opportunity to improve their small businesses and increase their income thus improving the quality if living for their families.

Cristina sell seafood itinerantly, Katheen Bianka bakes artisan pastries and Delita sells provisions, fruits and vegetables.

Delita is a member of the "Salvage" communal bank. She is a friendly 45 year old woman who is married and has 4 children who study in secondary and primary schools. Her husband works in small scale fishing. For the past two years she has sold seafood, fish carbon and supplies itinerantly and at bus stops putting a piece of black plastic. She works selling fish, supplies and carbon and in this way contributes to the household expenses and the education of her children. She is requesting the loan to increase her inventory of vegetables, fruit and provisions to increase her income. She and her husband dream of having a small store to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to increase their inventory of vegetables, fruits and provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the raw perfumes and bottles for his new business.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en: Sayohat is 23 years old. She is married but does not have children yet. She lives in the Vose region. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Sayohat is a hardworking woman. She sells clothes in the market. She has engaged in this activity for 2 years. Sayohat began her business with the help of her husband. The economic situation in Russia is bad, and the sharp fall of the ruble strongly affects the work of migrants. Revenue in Russia has decreased, and for Sayohat it is necessary to expand her business and increase her income to cover family expenses. She decided to ask for credit and buy goods. Sayohat really needs your support. Thank you.

loans.use: To buy goods, expand her business and increase her income to cover family expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pipes, a shower, ceramic and other materials to finish making a bathroom in his house and improve the living conditions for the good of his family.

loans.name: Dúo Castillo Fuerte Group

texts.es: Dúo Castillo Fuerte, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Ana Maria de 27 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, se ha dedica a está actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles ya que nececita invertir mas para generar mas ganancias.
texts.en: Ana Maria is a member of the duo Castillo Fuerte. She is 27 years old and who makes a living selling food-stuffs. She has been running her business for several years and she is taking this opportunity to ask for a loan so she can purchase more supplies. She feels she needs to invest more into her business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: purchase foodstuffs to re-sell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es: Candida de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 22 años su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y así poder  continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Candida is 62 years old, married, and lives with her husband in a home that they own. She has for the past 22 years sold used clothing at a market in her town. The income that Candida earns from her clothing business is enough to meet her household expenses. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of the wholesale clothing so that she can continue her sales and boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Aelis

texts.es: Nelson tiene 33 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre desde hace 4 años. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 8 años se gana la vida como motorista de una empresa cercana  a su vivienda, lo que le permite salir adelante y sostener la economía de su hogar. Nelson desea construir una cochera en su vivienda, razón por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y hierro para construir una cochera que le permita resguardar su automóvil en un lugar más seguro.
texts.en:
Nelson is 33 and has lived in his own home together with his mother for 4 years. He is a hard-working man who, for the last 8 years, has earned a living as a motorcycle rider in a business close to his house. This allows him to get by and support the household finances.  

Nelson wishes to build a garage at his home and this is the reason he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and iron in order to build a garage. This will allow him to keep his car safe in a more secure place.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and iron in order to build a garage.

loans.name: Shodmongul

texts.en:
Shodmongul is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a rural area where women are active and hardworking. She is married and has one child.  She has ten years practice of doing business in agriculture. 

Shodmongul is a goal-oriented and responsible person. She does her activity very well and knows how to plant agricultural products. Her family lives in poorly and in not so good conditions. Her husband is a pensioner and too disabled to work. It is hard for Shodmongul to feed her family. She asks for a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders for personal expenses. They need daily meals and clothes to wear. She hopes to buy needed items like clothes and food to live.

loans.use: buy food & clothing

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is a strong man. He was born in a rural area in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. He lives in an attractive scene and soft weather place, the village of Darhon. He is married and has two children. He feels a responsibility to feed and grow their children and to educate them. Recently he has been busy with agriculture, and his wife supports him to do a business. They live very poorly in bad conditions in order to reduce some difficulties with finance. Each year he went to Russia to earn money. This year he planned to stay home and does business in agriculture, planting potato and wheat. He asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers and corn to have a good harvest and live better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and corn

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to buy materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Ylando would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in making doormats and rags for sale. She makes various shapes of doormats. Her round palm-sized rugs are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counter. Doormats and rags are major item for housekeeping and cleaning and are changed constantly to ensure cleanliness. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and her good sales of her items since it covers their daily sustenance.

Yolanda hopes to be sustain and grow her business. She prays for good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy weaving supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
42-year-old Marites is a married woman with three children ages 5, 13 and 16. She and her family live in Badian, Cebu. For eleven years, she has been operating a sari-sari store business and she also sells fresh fish for additional income. This earn her an average of 9000 PHP per month. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasoning.  Marites' income will be used to pay for school fees and food for her family. In the future, she hope to expand her business and offer variety of additional merchandise for an increased income.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is grateful that she was granted a 24,000 PHP loan which she used to buy grocery items to sell at her small general store. Her earnings helped her be able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her store, she also earns through her doormat making business as she appears in her photo.

She would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to increase her grocery items, and partly to pay for fabrics, scrap cloth and thread to make various designs and colors of doormats. Her round palm-sized rags and colorful doormats are major items for housekeeping and cleaning and are changed constantly to ensure cleanliness. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and a good return on her investment for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Nenita hopes to sustain and grow her businesses. She aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She dreams of giving her family a better life through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell, and scrap cloth and other materials as well to make and sell doormats.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek was born in the village Tsaghkunk of Gegharkunik region and still lives there today. He is married and has three sons, none of them is married.

Aghabek has vocational education and graduated from a trading college. For several years he worked as a fireman and started from 2011 until today he works at the local school as a teacher of physical education.  His work does not prevent him from being engaged in farming. With the help of his wife and son he takes care of his farm cattle.  He has cows, calves, a bull and sheep. His wife manages to sell their farm products such as milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product), curd and meat.  

Aghabek and his wife greatly want to make their farm richer with cattle in order to have more income since very soon their elder son will get married and both the family and its needs will increase.  With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Aghabek will use for the purchase of one more cow and fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: buy a cow & cattle fodder

loans.name: Garush

texts.en:
Garush from the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region.  He hopes for his second deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon, since his first deal was really great in supporting his family. He mentions that farming and land cultivation is the only and constant source of income for his family. His farm cattle (cows, heifers, sheep, piglets, and chickens) and a plot of land with potato cultivation support his family and provide them with minimum needs.  From his farm Garush sells milk, cheese, macun (national dairy product), eggs, and sometimes mutton as well. 

Garush used to gather hay from his land for his farm cattle, but his hay mowing machine out of order. He asked for this loan as he wants to buy a hay mowing machine since the one that is out of order now cannot be repaired and used again.

loans.use: buy a hay machine

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
