Amina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven de 24 años de edad, soltero y solo con el compromiso de trabajar con mucho empeño y amor por una noble causa, darles un descanso a sus padres que tanto se sacrifican en el campo por llevar la comida.
Héctor tiene un compromiso que es retribuirles a sus padres por todo lo que han hecho por él y con ese pensamiento ha conseguido buenos frutos, tiene un negocio de lechería, cuenta con una vaca y quiere duplicar su producción.

Solicita un préstamo para ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le traerá enormes beneficios dado que duplicara su producción  cuenta con un espacio para que la vaca viva cómodamente.
texts.en: Héctor is a 24 year old single youth with only the compromise to work with much determination and love for a noble cause. Which is to give his parents a rest as they have sacrificed so much in the fields earning their food. Hector has a compromise which is to pay back his parents for all they have done for him and with this thought he has reaped good results. He has a milk business with one cow and he wants to double his production. He is requesting a loan  to arrange the money to buy a milk cow that will bring enormous benefits since it will double his production. He has the space for the cow to live comfortably.

loans.use: to arrange the money to buy a cow and double his milk production.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is 35 years old, and a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a small general store at the corner of his house. He makes a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. They have two children. They want to provide their children with good-quality food, clothing and health. For her husband's business, Fozia has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices. In this way, her husband would to able to cater the maximum number of customers.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to cater to the maximum number of customers.

loans.name: Samouen's Group

texts.en:
Samouen is 52 years old and is a married woman who lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming; and to earn more income, she also does potato farming. She can earn around 43,000 KHR per day to make a living and support her family.

Samouen’s group consists of two members, and this is the second loan cycle for her with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The past loan helped her to have enough household consumables available for her family to use. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for this loan and will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her current business. She hopes that she will be able to earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Busime Group

texts.en:
Tulinabantu (far right in the photo) is part of the group Busime and lives in the Uvira, Democratic Republic of Congo. She is 33 years old and married. Together she and her husband have 5 children, all are attending school. 

Tulinabantu has been running her business selling bread and doughnuts for 2 years. She is on her third Wezesha Project loan. With this loan she is going to increase her capacity and purchase more flour to cook doughnuts, this is the most profitable part of her business. In the coming years she would like to purchase a parcel of land with her profits.

loans.use: buy bread & flour

loans.name: Buguma Group

texts.en:
Estela (far left) is a 59-year-old vegetable vendor. She is a widow and mother of 6 adult children. She is from the city of Uvira in the Democratic Republic of Congo. She has been in the business of selling produce for 14 years and this is the way she knows to make a living.  From the current business she can earn about $1.5 per day. 

Estela has joined Wezesha Project about one year ago. Since joining her personal confidence has grown and now she is leading her lending group. She wants to use her portion to restock her business. She hopes to be the major supplier of tomatoes to whole the city in the future.

loans.use: buy tomatoes

loans.name: Da None Chaung Village - Group 2

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Da None Chaung - Group 2, named (from left to right) Myint, Aye, Phyo, Win and Zaw.  The featured borrower, Myint, has an eight-acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, his income is very low before harvest season.  The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs to harvest his crops.  Myint is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of three (one child who is three years old). Myint and his family hope to eventually be able to save enough money to buy more land to expand his business.

The fund will help a total of 35 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group, and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Da None Chaung - Group 2 Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs, as well as plantation of betel trees and flowers, for additional income.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds, fertilizers and purchase petrol for farm equipment

loans.name: Nyaung Wine Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Nyaung Wine Village, named Thein, Myint, Than, Soe and Kyaw. The featured borrower, Thein, has a 21-acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, his income is very low before harvest season. This loan will help him buy the farming resources he needs to harvest his crops and to pay for labor. 

Thein is 57 years old, married, and supports a family of seven (five children).  Thein and his family hope that the child left in his family, who is also a student, can go to university after he finished high school. Furthermore, he and his family hope to eventually be able to save enough money to expand his farming business by buying more paddy fields.

The fund will help 31 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group, and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Nyaung Win Village’s main focus is crop farming (rice), as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs for additional income.

loans.use: rent farm equipment, buy petrol & hire laborers

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.en: Aline's group Maombi consists of 5 members who are all female.  She is 19 years old and married. Aline (center of photo) lives in the village of Kiliba located in Eastern of Democratic Republic of Congo. She has been member of Wezesha Project in Maombi group for two years already and completely paid back all loans on time. The past loans have helped improve her standard of living. She is now leading her group her group in Wezesha Project. As the group leader Aline wants to use her portion to buy more sacs of charcoal. With this loan she hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
The Group Neema comprises of five women who work in the commercial domain. They are from Kiliba Village, situated in the Uvira region of Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. They are gathered to benefit from Wezesha Project support. This is their third loan from Wezesha project and they have an excellent record of repayment. With the help of loans they support their families and increase their businesses. 

Furaha (second from the left) is married, 32 years old and mother of 5 children. Furaha will use her loan to purchase second-hand shoes to sell. This has helped her to maintain the necessary income to support her family and repay debt that they previously had

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Akossiwa est âgée de 51 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Pour aider sa famille à avoir un bon cadre de vie, Akossiwa vend du miel dans le quartier et en se promenant dans les marchés afin d’avoir le revenu nécessaire. Pour bien vendre sa marchandise, Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akossiwa veut mieux réaliser ses ventes pour bien satisfaire ses clients et demande ce prêt pour acheter des bidons de miel. Akossiwa désire augmenter son épargne et pourvoir considérablement aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. Akossiwa is 51 years old and a mother to four children. In order to help her family live in good conditions, Akossiwa sells honey in the neighborhood and while walking around in the markets to make the revenue she needs. To sell her merchandise well, Akossiwa resupplies two time per month at the market. Akossiwa wants to achieve improved sales to better satisfy her clients, so she is asking for this loan to buy containers of honey. Akossiwa wishes to increase her savings and considerably provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy to containers of honey.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya is 35 years old, a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales in order to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
At the age of 31, Pathani is a married woman. She has been doing  agriculture work for some years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Pathani has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Faizaa

texts.en:
Faizaa is 43 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Faizaa ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Faizaa  has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants  to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Faizaa is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is 54 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. Together with her son (also shown in the photo), she has been doing agriculture work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Sahib has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, 47 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Balqees needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of the high cost of transportation and competition in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Loky

texts.fr: Agée de 22 ans et mariée, Loky est une femme qui habite à Adidogomé avec ses trois enfants. Loky est une commerçante de friperies qui vend ses tenues dans son quartier et alentours pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Cette activité permet à Loky d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir la vie éducative de ses enfants. Loky s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. loky demande ce crédit pour commander des serviettes, des draps et des habits. Grâce au bénéfice, Loky souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille
texts.en: Loky is a 22 years old, married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her three children. Loky is a second-hand clothing merchant who sells her cloths in her neighborhood and nearby to positively satisfy her clients. This business allows Loky to have a good savings to invest in the education of her children. Loky resupplies two times per month at the market. Loky is requesting this loan to order towels, bed sheets and cloths. Thanks to the profits, Loky wishes to improve her services and to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pack of towels, 20 bed sheets et 50 clothing articles.

loans.name: Kawempe Royal School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is John. He is the head teacher of Kawempe Royal College, a mixed school of 600 students in the urban area of Kawempe in Kampala. 

Kawempe Royal School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kawempe Royal School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a single mother with two children, both of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She has sold used clothing for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX  from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality of clothes. She wants to buy a plot of land in the future. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, who is in her early 40s, is married with one son who is still in school. She has been running two projects: a grocery store and selling chips for four years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Naomi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy drinks for the grocery store and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of making her business grow big.

Naomi will make sure she pays back her loan within the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Celsa requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as wood, paint, etc. for the maintenance of her business.

Celsa has been in this business for 29 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Celsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as wood, paint, etc. for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and widowed, with two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and corn in the Philippines. Editha requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Editha has been farming vegetables and corn for 30 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melly is 41 years old. 

Melly has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Melly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Marife has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional equipment and tools for her business.

Marife has been in this business for thirteen years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and tools for her business.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Balqees has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to increase her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides to increase her sales and profits as well.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single woman who has no kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Agnes operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, three crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, three crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman and who is staying together with her five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business, selling plastic chairs, cups and ovens from home to her neighbours and in the market too. Her business is thriving well and she opts to enjoy the profits in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase plastic chairs for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs for her business.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Célestine est une femme mariée. Célestine est mère de deux enfants et habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Célestine vend des friperies dans son quartier. Célestine réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des culotes, des habits et des jupes, Célestine demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Célestine is a 44 year old married woman. Célestine is a mother to two children and lives in the area Adidogomé. Célestine sells second-hand cloths in her neighborhood. Célestine is attaining a revenue through her business to help her children. Célestine resupplies once per month at the market. Célestine is requesting this loan to purchase underwear, cloths, and skirts in order to fulfill her goals and to gain a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 67 pairs of underwear, 100 piles of cloths and 50 piles of skirts.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and a mother who lives in Kaloleni. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Rehema is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Rehema is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Msambeta Group

texts.en:
Lauryn appreciates Kiva for the assistance that they gave her by granting her a loan. She used the loan to buy bales of secondhand clothes, and she used the profits to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with an adequate amount of food.

She is requesting another loan in order to buy more bales of clothes, as this will help her increase her supply, thereby also increasing the demand. She plans to diversify her business into a general store when she accumulates enough capital.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Nusula

texts.en: Nusula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. Her major challenge includes the seasonality of food. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 39 years old and married, with three children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Delia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fish and fruit-vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married, with six children. With four children currently in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell, like detergent soap, soft drinks, juice, shampoo, candies, and biscuits.

Elena has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, soft drinks, juice, shampoo, candies, and biscuits. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like detergent soap, soft drinks, juice, shampoo, candies, and biscuits.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is 64 years old and single.

Bernarda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, detergent soap, beer, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Bernarda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, beer, coffee, cereals, etc.

In the future, Bernarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, detergent soap, beer, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora, Santos de 64 años de edad, es casada tiene casa propia  y ella radica en la comunidad de El Guayabo # 1 Se dedica desde hace 10 años a su pulpería sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos personas de la comunidad quienes la visitan en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
Doña Santos  es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  PRISMA y Kiva  por la oportunidad que le está brindando a ella y sus amigos.
Doña Santos esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de Plásticos y Refrescos ya que en la temporada de verano los refrescos se venden en mayor cantidad. Doña Santos con el apoyo del crédito pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio.
Doña Santos solicita 10,000 lempiras para compra de Plásticos, y con el apoyo de este préstamo espera invertirlo y mejorar más sus ingresos.
Doña Santos su sueño es que en su próximo crédito  mejorar mas su negocio vivienda para ayudar más a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Marzo del 2015.
texts.en:
Santos is 64 years old and married. She has her own house and lives in the community of El Guayabo #1. For the last ten years she has made a living in her grocery store. Her customers are friends and neighbours, people from the community who visit her in the municipal market of San Lorenzo. Santos is a hard-working woman who really wants to get ahead, and she is grateful to PRISMA and Kiva for the opportunity they provide for her and her friends.

Santos requests this loan in order to buy plastic containers and soft drinks, since in the summer soft drinks sell very well. She hopes to use the loan to buy stock and improve her business. Santos is asking for 10,000 Honduran lempiras in order to buy plastic containers, and with the help of this loan she hopes to improve her income more.

Santos' dream is to improve her business and home with this loan and to help her family.

San Lorenzo, Valle – March 2015.

loans.use: buy plastic containers and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell.

Eva has been in this business for years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marissa is 40 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Marissa has a upholstery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Pedra is 38 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Pedra has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pedra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Her name is Teresita, 47, and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Patricio, a supervisor, and has three  children of which one is in high school, one in elementary, and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs, and to send her two children to school. 

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  Aside from her store business, she will also be a subcontractor of garments. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP15000 loan which she will use to buy some grocery items. She will also pay for the new sewing machines shown in her photo which she will use to sew clothes as a subcontractor of a garments factory. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, and a good return of her investment for it will surely meet their daily expense and to send her children to school.

Teresita hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add some groceries to her store, and to pay for a sewing machine to sew garments as well.

loans.name: Ngalla Sona's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 29 Janvier 1998 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint son trente deuxième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame  Ngalle (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 61 ans, veuve et mère 02 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de glace, d’eau fraiche et de crème glacée. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  04 sacs de sucre de 50 kg à 22000f le sac, 03 bassines de 25 litre  d’oseille pour les crèmes glacées  à 4000 f la bassine, 05 bassines  de pain de singe à 2000f la bassine toujours pour les crèmes glacées des sachets et d’autres condiments pour ensuite le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de ses enfants : scolarisation et  les soins médicaux.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created on 29th January 1998.  Since then the organisation has reached its 32nd cycle in the banc villageois programme.  The women are very close and have worked together to develop a group with spirit and solidarity and one which was welcomed by the village's public figures. Petty trade is their main business activity.  

Mrs. Ngalle (stood on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the lead borrower and is 61 years old.  She is widowed and the mother of two boys.  She actively sells ice, fresh water and ice-cream.  She has a lot of experience in this area.  

With her new loan, she plans to buy: 4 x 50kg bags of sugar at 22000f each, 3 x 25l tubs of sorrel for ice-cream at 4000f each, 5 tubs of baobab fruit for the ice-cream at 2000f each, some tea bags and other ingredients to resell fully in her neighbourhood.  


With the profits, she hopes to provide schooling and medical care for her children.

loans.use: to buy 4 x 50kg bags of sugar at 22000f each, 3 x 25l tubs of sorrel for ice-cream at 4000f each and 5 tubs of baobab fruit

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 30 years old and has nine children. Virginia is married and has seven children who are currently in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business; pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Virginia has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Tushirikiane. Group

texts.en: Rosette is the leader of the group Tushirikiane, and this Group is a part of Wezesha Project situated in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Rosette is married, she is the mother of three children and she is 24 years old. Her husband is unemployed. She is the second from the left in the photo. Rosette has been selling eggs for 5 years now, and this is her 7th loan from Wezesha Project. With this loan of $400 she will purchase more eggs to resell in order to generate more income. She wants to use the profits of the loan to reinvest in her activity and feed her family. Her biggest dream is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase eggs.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
The person on the photo is Annastasia. She is 43 years old and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming of cabbage, spinach and other vegetables. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy certified seed and fertilizer to increase vegetable production to enable her meet her customers' demand and pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and she promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy certified seed and fertilizer to increase vegetable production to enable her meet her customers' demand and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
The person in the photo is David. He is 53 years old, married and has six children. He has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training mostly learning entrepreneurial skills.

David repairs shoes as a business and has applied for a Kiva loan to buy shoe repairing materials which will improve his services and enable him to increase his income and pay school fees for his children. 

He is happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy shoe repairing materials which will improve his services and enable him increase his income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. Two years ago, he started a new business, an Internet cafe. He provides services for university students and also games for the kids. It is a good business but still needs some development. 
Majdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new computers for his cafe and serve more clients. By taking out this loan, Majdi will increase his income. 
Majdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wire and nails to change the sheeting of the roof of her house.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 29 Janvier 1998 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint son trente deuxième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Awa (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de déjeuné et de jus de fruits a la gare routière. Elle jouit d’une expérience de plus de cinq dans  ce domaine d’activité

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter cinq sac de riz à 12500 Fr FCA l’un, un sac d’oignon à 11500 Fr CFA de l’huile végétale à 20000 Fr CFA et du sucre à 20000 Fr CFA le sac,  pour la vente de jus .   

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charges de certains besoins familiaux (soins médicaux et scolarités des enfants) et aussi d’augmenter son épargne au sein du banc villageois.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created on 29th January 1998. Since then the organisation has reached its 32nd cycle in the banc villageois programme. The women are very close and have worked together to develop a group with spirit and solidarity and one which was welcomed by the village's public figures. Petty trade is their main business activity.

Mrs. Awa (stood on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the lead borrower and is 36 years old.  She is married and mother to two children; one boy and one girl.  She actively sells lunch ingredients and fruit juice at the bus station.  She has more than five years of experience in this business.  

This new loan will allow her to buy: five bags of rice at 12500 fr FCA each, one sack of onions at 11500 Fr CFA, some vegetable oil at 20000 Fr CFA and some sugar at 20000 Fr CFA per bag, to sell juice.

The profits will allow her to take responsibility of the family's needs (medical care and childrens' schooling) and also to increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy five bags of rice at 12500 fr FCA each, one sack of onions at 11500 Fr CFA, some vegetable oil at 20000 Fr CFA and some sugar at 20000 Fr CFA per bag, to sell juice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
Ovilla is thankful that she was granted a 13,000 PHP loan which she used to buy more vegetables and some groceries needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for her new refrigerator to store fresh meat, sweetened beans and fruits to make barbecue and "halu-halo" (literally "Mix-Mix", a traditional Filipino treat consisting of a blend of fruits, sweet preserves, evaporated milk, and shaved ice). Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Ovilla dreams of having a bigger General Store. She aims to give her children a College Education to allow them a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a refrigerator to store fresh meat (pork, chicken) in order to make and sell barbecue; and to buy sweetened fruits and beans to make and sell "halu-halo"

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 44 years old. She is married with eight children, aged between 9 and 23 years. They all go to school, and they are in private schools. She owns a shop and she has been doing business for the past 5 years. Her husband is a business man also. She is requesting for a school fees loan, and she would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to expand her business in order to better prepare her future.

loans.use: to pay in installments for school fees.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Hannah. She is 47 years old, married and a mother of four children, all in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

She raises poultry as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training in enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to budget and keep better records. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by adding more chickens so that she can increase her income. This will help her meet her family's needs and pay school fees for her children. 

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chickens to help boost production.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Helen; she is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in May 2013. 
Helen does firewood selling as her main business.She is grateful to HiH EA for developing an entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorships. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a bicycle for transporting firewood, and she hopes to get more profit and enable supporting her young family's needs such as education and food.

Helen is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle that will help boost her firewood selling business by easing transportation.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The man in the photo is John. He is 21 years old and married with one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development.

John operates a bodaboda (motorcycle business) and also operates a small electrical shop. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more electrical wire and bulbs to increase stock and meet his customers' demand to increase sales.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more electrical wire and bulbs to increase stock and meet his customers' demand, resulting in more sales.

loans.name: Angela Cecilia

texts.es: Ángela de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos tres de ellos mayores de edad y uno de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, que es el platillo típico del país, dicha actividad le permite sostener a  su familia. Ángela ha decidido ampliar su vivienda, ya que siente que es muy pequeña y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI, el cual invertirá en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para ampliar su vivienda, brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela, 37 years old, is a working woman that lives in her own home with her spouse and 4 children, three of them adults and one 7 year old. 

She is an entrepreneur who has worked making and selling pupusas, a typical dish from her country, for 15 years now. This work allows her to support her family. 

Ángela has decided to expand her home, as she feels it is very small, and to do that she is asking for a loan from FUSAI, which she will invest in: bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to expand her house, giving a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to expand her home.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 29 Janvier 1998 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint son trente deuxième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye (debout derrière et à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés qu’elle achète à Dakar pour le revendre en détail à Kolda de a bouillie et de crème glacée.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 30 coupons  de tissus teintés à 8000f  le coupon 02 bassines d’oseilles à 4000f l’une pour la vente de jus et 24 sachets pour la vente de glace.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et prendre soins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created on 29th January 1998. Since then the organisation has reached its 32nd cycle in the banc villageois programme. The women are very close and have worked together to develop a group with spirit and solidarity and one which was welcomed by the village's public figures. Petty trade is their main business activity.

Mrs. Ramatoulaye (stood at the back of the photo on the right) is the lead borrower of the group.  She is married, 43 years old and mother to two children; one boy and one girl.  She actively sells dyed fabrics which she buys in Dakar and resells in Kolda; she also sells porridge and ice-cream.

With the new loan she will buy: 30 cuts of dyed fabric at 8000f each, two tubs of sorrel at 4000f each to sell juice and 24 small bags to sell ice-cream.

With the profits, she will support her husband in managing daily expenditure and taking care of the children.

loans.use: to buy 30 cuts of dyed fabric at 8000f each, two tubs of sorrel at 4000f each to sell juice and 24 small bags to sell ice-cream.

loans.name: Manguiline Santhiaba Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba a été inauguré le 21 février 2001. Ce groupe compte six femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce et se soutiennent solidairement. Elle remboursent toujours leurs prêts à temps. Madame Fatou Déme qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont deux garçons et trois filles. Depuis plus de cinq ans elle pratique le commerce de poissons. Son activé marche très fort malgré la concurrence. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des enfants(habillement, nourriture et santé).
texts.en:
The Manguiline Santhiaba Group banc villageois was founded on February 21, 2001. This group includes six women who are active in business and support one another in solidarity. They always repay their loans on time.

Mrs. Fatou Déme, who is at right raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative. She is married, 37 years old, and the mother of five children, two boys and three girls. Mrs. Fatou Déme has been selling fish for more than five years. Her business is very strong, despite the competition. The profits [from this loan] will help care for her children (clothing, food, and health).

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to be trained on savings mobilization, enterprise development, and financial management. 

She practices dairy farming where she keeps dairy cows and sells milk within her locality. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy animals feed which will enable her to increase milk production, hence meeting her customers demands and also earning more income.
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy animal feed which will enable her to increase milk production, hence meeting her customers' demands, and also earning more income.

loans.name: Lolahan

texts.ru: Лолахан, 39 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-среднее, много лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На 0,50 Га арендованной и 0,30 Га собственной земли она выращивает рис.  Ежемесячный доход Лолахан составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лолахан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на подготовку земли к весенне-полевым работам, посадку риса и покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Лолахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Lolahan is 39 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education, and has raised animals and grown crops for many years. She has 2 cows on her farm, and she grows rice on 0.5 hectares of rented land and 0.3 hectares of her own land. She makes up to 25,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further expand her business, Lolahan has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to prepare her land for spring planting, to plant rice, and to buy a cow. Lolahan plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in the further development of her business and improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to cultivate her land, grow organic rice, and to buy one cow.

loans.name: Sury Graciela

texts.es: Sury de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hermana y su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica  a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este ingreso económico. Sury desea ampliar su vivienda, ya que ha observado que viven en hacinamiento, y para ello ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda y brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sury, 37 years old, lives in her own home with her spouse, sister and her 3 year old daughter. She is a business woman that has worked selling clothing as a street vendor for 6 years, and as such she counts on a large quantity of clients that ask for her products. She is happy to be able to have this income. 

Sury wants to expand her home, as she has noticed that they are overcrowded, and for that reason she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to expand her home and to give a better accommodation to her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to expand her home.

loans.name: Gladis Isabel

texts.es: Gladis es una mujer que tiene 39 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, por lo que desde hace 15 años presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana. Gladis  siente que viven muy incómodos en su vivienda, por la falta de espacios en la misma y para ello desea ampliar su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava ladrillo y duralita para ampliar su vivienda y de esta forma brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She is a remarkable woman who strives every day to bring her children up as a single parent. Since 15 years ago, she has been providing security service for a nearby company. 

Gladis feels very uncomfortable living in her house due to lack of space. She wants to expand her house. She requests a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and Duralita sheeting to expand her house and therefore provide greater comfort for her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and Duralita sheeting to expand her house.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz a sus 28 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de cafetería que estará ubicado en una esquina muy transitada del barrio donde reside en municipio de Norcasia.

Ella desea ofrecer en su negocio todo tipo de alimentos  como arepas de queso, patacones de plátano, chorizos con arepa, butifarras, arepas de chócolo, gaseosas entre otros, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Luz es una señora trabajadora, pujante, emprendedora, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (sillas, carpa) e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Luz, at 28 years old and due to the lack of employment opportunities and because of the financial need, is motivated to become independent and generate her own income. This is why she wants to start a cafeteria business that will be located in a busy corner of the community where she lives, in the municipality of Norcasia. She wants to offer all kinds of foods such as cheese arepas (corn cakes), fried plantain, chorizos (sausages) with arepa, sausages, corn arepas and beverages among others. With this she hopes to get the necessary resources to cover her basic expenses. Luz is a hard working woman who thrives and is an entrepreneur. 

She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (chairs, tent) and ingredients to prepare the meals (cold cuts, oil, arepas (corn cakes), plantains, beverages), to have a stock and a variety of products to satisfy the likes of her customer. This way she will have a better quality of life and well-being.

Because of the support of the Corporación Interactuar and of the Kiva lenders she will be able to start her business and become independent.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (chairs, tent) and ingredients to prepare the meals (cold cuts, oil, arepas (corn cakes), plantains, beverages)

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Amelita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Amelita has been raising cattle for 12 years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Magha Women Group

texts.en:
The lady lifting her hand in the photo is Hannah. She is 51 years old, married, a mother of five, and a member of Magha Women Group. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings, she has been able to embrace dairy farming as a business.

Hannah practices dairy farming where she has two cows and she has applied for a Kiva loan to buy a dairy cow and, hence, increase milk production and enable her to earn more income and also meet her customers' demands.

She is very grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Blanca Lyliam

texts.es:
Blanca, de 63 años de edad, es una persona honesta y responsable, es viuda y tiene dos hijos; después que falleció su esposo, tuvo que trabajar para llevar darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. 

Blanca, tiene 6 años de haber colocado una tienda en su casa y es de donde ella obtiene los recursos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

El crédito que está solicitando Blanca, es para comprar un medicamento que le han recetado y es bastante caro, es por eso que ella necesita de la ayuda del crédito, para poder comprar su medicamento y recuperar su salud.

Blanca, sueña con seguir trabajando en su tienda y junto a su hija poder ampliarla, para que le genere un poco más de ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca, 63 years old, is an honest and responsible person. She is a widow and has two children. After her husband passed away, she had to work to be able to give her children everything they needed. 

6 years ago, Blanca set up a store in her house and that is where she gets the income to support her family. 

The loan that Blanca is asking for is to buy a medicine that has been prescribed to her and is too expensive. For this reason she needs help from a loan to be able to buy her medicine and regain her health. 

Blanca dreams of continuing to work in her store, and be able to expand it with her daughter to generate a bit more earnings.

loans.use: to buy medicine that has been prescribed to her and is too expensive.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La socia Gavina pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS.
La socia tiene 36 años de edad tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia cultiva lo que son frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The featured borrower, Gavina, belongs to the “Las Hormiguitas” Communal Bank. 

The borrower is 36 years old and has one son.  She alternates between her daily activities and her agriculture business.  The borrower grows fruits, such as plantains and oranges, among others.  She has been working in this business for a while, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  In this way, she helps her family succeed.

The borrower is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and compost.

The borrowers are grateful for the loan they have been granted, and they are committed to fulfilling their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Латофат мать-героиня пятерых детей. Она разведенная и одна вырастила детей. Ей всего 44 года. Дочерям 15, 17, 18 сыновьям 11 и 24 года. Старший сын находится заграницей на заработках. Маме становилось тежелее одной вырастить пятерых детей. Он женился и уехал на заработки. Четверо младших детей учатся в школе. Латофат как и многие женщины республики занимается шитьем. Латофат принимает заказы на шитье на дому. 
  Латофат давно мечтала отремонтировать дом. При климате Таджикистана необходимо часто ремонтировать жилищное помощение, но дом Латофат несколько лет не ремонтировался. Она собрала сбережения, но ей не хватает денег на приобретения достаточного количество стройматериалов и она решилась обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Latofat is a "Mother-Heroine" of five children. She is divorced and has raised her children on her own. She is only 44 years old. Latofat's daughters are 15, 17, and 18, and her sons are 11 and 24 years old. Her oldest son is in another country looking for work. It became difficult for his mother to raise five children on her own, so he married and left to find work. The four younger children are in school. Like many women in her country, Latofat sews for a living. She takes orders and sews at home.

Latofat has dreamed for a long time of repairing her house. In Tajikistan's climate, houses frequently need to be repaired, but Latofat's house has not been repaired for many years. She got together her savings, but she didn't have enough money to purchase all the building materials she needed, and she ultimately decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, brick, and iron to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III,la socia sigue con su negocio de restaurant , la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, carnes, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "NUEVA GENERACION III." She is continuing to work in her restaurant business. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to comply with the payment schedule. She is a responsible and earnest person and thus she moves her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as rice, meat, beans, and others.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as rice, meat, beans and others.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from enterprise development training and financial management.

He is doing vegetable farming where he grows kale and spinach. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to enable him boost his vegetables production, and hence be able to meet his customers’ needs and earn more income. He also sells clothes to diversify his income. He is happy with Kiva and all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to enable him boost his vegetables production, and hence be able to meet his customers' needs and earn more income.

loans.name: Zawadi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ann. She is 46 years old and married with 11 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She runs a cafe where she sells milk and food. She gained knowledge to manage her business through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on Enterprise start up and development. 

She is borrowing a loan to purchase wheat flour, utensils, chairs and tables for the cafe to accommodate more customers. This will improve her income, hence she will be in a position to pay school fees for her children and continue supporting her family’s needs. Ann is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for wheat flour, utensils, chairs and tables for the cafe to accommodate more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Alice; she is 72 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She does vegetable farming as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer, so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from the sales. This will assist her to cater for her upkeep. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Nancy; she is 23 years old, married and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to learn and gain more experience in enterprise start up and development.  She also learned skills in financial management, which has helped her manage her finances prudently.  

She sells fish, vegetables and fruits, which have enabled her earn income for her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing. She is borrowing a loan to add more stock to the food kiosk. This will enable her to increase income, and hence be in a position to educate her children. Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  fish, vegetables and fruits to help meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build the wall in her house.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III,el socio  sigue dedicándose a su negocio de restaurant, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, menestras entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "NUEVA GENERACION III" communal bank. He continues to work at his restaurant business. He is grateful for the loan offered and promises to comply with the the payments of the installments. He is a responsible and determined person this being his way to get his family ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like rice and legumes amongst others.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice and legumes amongst others.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Estela has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Estela aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anje

texts.en:
Anje is 31 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Anje has been in this business for seven years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Anje would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erna is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Erna has a pottery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery making.

Erna has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery making.

loans.name: Ana Ruby

texts.en:
Ana Ruby is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Ruby is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ana Ruby has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ana Ruby has been in this business for six years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Barut Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Daisy, a member of Barut Young Mothers Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 
27 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiHEA) in January, 2013.

Daisy operates a salon and also sells cosmetic products. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiHEA) which has enabled her  to acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase additional salon stock, such as hair gel and weaves. This will increase her  income through which she will educate her children, provide medical care and meet other family needs.

Daisy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy salon stock such as hair gel and weaves that will help meet customers rising demands

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Raeli; she is married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiHEA) in 2013.

Raeli is a maize and beans farmer, and also farms cabbages. She is grateful to HiHEA for enterprise training on business management. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farming inputs like seeds and fertilizers to help boost her cabbage farming. She hopes to get more profits and enable her to cater to her family needs, such as education and food.

Raeli is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Menchu

texts.en:
Menchu is 45 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Menchu has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

Menchu has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III ,el socio sigue  dedicándose al negocio de molinera, el muele granos de trigo, cebada y maíz y lo convierte en harinas y lo reparte en las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes , el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cebada entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "NUEVA GENERACION III" communal bank. He continues to work in his mill business. He grinds wheat, barley and corn and converts it into flour and distributes it to a variety of grocery stores. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments. He is a responsible and determined person this being the way he gets his family ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy barley amongst others.

loans.use: to buy barley amongst others.

loans.name: Crislin

texts.en:
Crislin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Crislin is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Crislin has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of rice to sell.

Crislin has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 67 years old; she married with 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marieta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marieta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anelene

texts.en:
Anelene is 41 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anelene runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Anelene has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ermelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Ermelinda is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

Ermelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture and a quantity of soft drink products to restock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. She also hopes that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and a quantity of soft drink products to restock her cafe

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Мавзуна 29 летняя девушка из северного городка Худжанд. Она живет у родителей. Мавзуна развелась с мужем и с сыном была вынуждена вернуться обратно в родительский дом. Сыну Мавзуны 7 лет. 
   Мавзуна дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она любит свою работу и этой деятельностью она может прокормить детей и помочь родителям Мавзуна обратилась за кредитом, для купли швейной машинки. Ее старая машинка не пригодна для дальнейшего использования. Ее сбережения не позволяют ей совершить покупку, и она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что ей не откажут в кредите.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a 29-year-old young woman from the northern city of Khujand. She lives with her parents. She and her husband divorced and she and her son had to return to her parents' home. Her son is seven years old.

Mavzuna works from home sewing women's clothing. She loves her work and with this profession she is able to feed her child and help her parents. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine as her old machine doesn't work anymore and she doesn't have enough money to pay for the purchase on her own. She hopes that she will receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so she can continue her business

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food such as rice and meat, and buy new dishes to sell and satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increasing sales and helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new dishes and better quality food such as rice and meat, to sell and satisfy her customers

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is requesting a new loan to buy fabric materials to make clothes to sell, and buy new glasses to sell coffee to people in her community.

Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials to make clothes to sell, and buy new glasses to sell coffee to people in her community.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi is requesting a new loan to buy new hairdressing tools and new hair accessory products to serve her customers. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools and new hair accessory products to serve her customers

loans.name: Nurinisso

texts.ru:
Нуриниссо 32 лет. Она из района Кубодиен. Нуриниссо замужем и имеет детей. Она вместе мамой, отцом и детьми живет в районе Кубодиен. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую  работу в стране. 
Нуриниссо в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она выращивает пшеницу, картофель и зелень. Нуриниссо трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она еще занимается продажей детских одежды на рынке.  В этом году она посадила пшеницу и картофель. Сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить хороший и качественный урожай. У Нуриниссо нет денег для купли минеральных удобрений, поэтому она просит кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей приобрести минеральных удобрений, и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Nurinisso is 32 years old and lives in the Qubadiyon region. Nurinisso is married and has children. She lives with her mother, father, and children in Qubadiyon. Her husband is working out of the country in the Russian Federation because he could not find suitable work in Tajikistan.

Nurinisso does agricultural work. She grows wheat, potatoes, and greens. Nurinisso is a hard-working and honest woman. She also sells children's clothing in the market. This year she has planted wheat and potatoes, and now she needs to cultivate her land with mineral fertilizer so that she will have a good and high-quality harvest. Nurinisso does not have the money to buy mineral fertilizer, so she is requesting a loan. The loan she is requesting will help her buy mineral fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and expand her business.
